original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, we will explain.

original: ris mthun pa'i ches rnams tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni phung po bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ris mthun pa'i ches rnams tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni phung po bshad pa'o //
translated: The aggregates were taught in order to demonstrate the characteristics of the collection of the components of a single life in a single class.

original: sgo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni skye mched bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sgo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni skye mched bshad pa'o //
translated: The bases were taught in order to demonstrate the characteristics of the doors of the senses.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni khams bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid bstan pa ni khams bshad pa'o //
translated: The elements were taught in order to demonstrate the characteristics of their individual natures.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis mgo smos pas go ba'i gang zag rnams la phung po'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sten par byed do //üîΩrnam par spros pas go ba'i gang zag rnams la skye mched kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis mgo smos pas go ba'i gang zag rnams la phung po'i sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sten par byed do // rnam par spros pas go ba'i gang zag rnams la skye mched kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ston par byed do //
translated: Alternatively, the Blessed One taught the truth of suffering from the perspective of the aggregates for those individuals who understand through brief statements.üîΩHe taught the truth of suffering from the perspective of the bases for those individuals who understand through elaboration.

original: tshig la 'chel ba'i gang zag rnams la khams kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sten par byed do //
analyzed: tshig la 'chel ba'i gang zag rnams la khams kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa sten par byed do //
translated: He taught the truth of suffering from the perspective of the elements for those individuals who are attached to words.

original: yang na gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po la sdug pa'i 'du shes can gyi gang zag la gzugs mdor bstan cing gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams dbye ba byas te phung po bstan to //
analyzed: yang na gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po la sdug pa'i 'du shes can gyi gang zag la gzugs mdor bstan cing gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po rnams dbye ba byas te phung po bstan to //
translated: Or else, the aggregates are taught to a person who has the notion of beauty with regard to the formless aggregates, by briefly teaching form and by dividing the formless aggregates.

original: @185a * // gzugs la sdug pa'i 'du shes can gyi gang zag la gzugs la mang du dbye ba byas te gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po mdor bsdus nas skye mched bstan to //
analyzed: @185a * // gzugs la sdug pa'i 'du shes can gyi gang zag la gzugs la mang du dbye ba byas te gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po mdor bsdus nas skye mched bstan to //
translated: The sense bases are taught to a person who has the notion of beauty with regard to form, by dividing form into many and by briefly summarizing the formless aggregates.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sdug pa'i 'du shes can la gzugs can ma yin pa dang gzugs can la mang du dbye ba byas te khams bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs la sdug pa'i 'du shes can la gzugs can ma yin pa dang gzugs can la mang du dbye ba byas te khams bstan to //
translated: The elements are taught to a person who has the notion of beauty with regard to form and the formless, by dividing form and the formless into many.

original: yang na gang bdag gi ngo bo dngos po ston pa de ni phung po bstan pa'o //üîΩgang dngos po'i dmigs pa ston pa de ni skye mched ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang bdag gi ngo bo dngos po ston pa de ni phung po bstan pa'o // gang dngos po'i dmigs pa ston pa de ni skye mched ston pa'o //
translated: Or else, the aggregates are taught to one who shows the entity that is the nature of the self.üîΩThe sense bases are taught to one who shows the object of that entity.

original: gang dngos po'i dmigs pa nges pa skyed ba ston pa de ni khams ston pa'o //
analyzed: gang dngos po'i dmigs pa nges pa skyed ba ston pa de ni khams ston pa'o //
translated: The elements are taught to one who shows the definite arising of the object of that entity.

original: gang rnam pa de rnams kyi khams shes pa'i rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa 'di ni khams la mkhas pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang rnam pa de rnams kyi khams shes pa'i rnam par bzhag pa la mkhas pa 'di ni khams la mkhas pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The expertise in the presentation of the elements that is knowledge of those aspects is called expertise in the elements.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las gnas brtan pa'i sde pa'i tshul lugs phung po skye mched khams rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las gnas brtan pa'i sde pa'i tshul lugs phung po skye mched khams rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: The great pa·πá·∏çita Da≈õabala≈õrƒ´bhadra composed this chapter on the ascertainment of the aggregates, bases, and constituents of the system of the Sthavira school in the Ascertainment of the Compounded and Uncompounded.

original: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: // / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ni 'di ltar /
translated: Expertise in dependent origination is as follows.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs dang / ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug dang / skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang /
translated: The conditions of ignorance are compositional activity, the conditions of compositional activity are consciousness, the conditions of consciousness are name and form, the conditions of name and form are the six sources, the conditions of the six sources are contact,

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba dang / skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Contact is a condition for feeling. Feeling is a condition for craving. Craving is a condition for grasping. Grasping is a condition for becoming. Becoming is a condition for birth. Birth is a condition for old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish to come into existence.

original: de lta bu 'ba' zhig gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnams kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lugs su byung ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu 'ba' zhig gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnams kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lugs su byung ba'o //
translated: Thus there comes into existence this whole great mass of suffering. This is the way things originate.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag / rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag / mid dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag / skye mched drug 'gags pas rig pa 'gag / reg pa 'gags
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag /'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag / rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag / mid dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag / skye mched drug 'gags pas rig pa 'gag / reg pa 'gags
translated: When ignorance ceases, the conditioning factors cease. When the conditioning factors cease, consciousness ceases. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. When name and form cease, the six sense spheres cease. When the six sense spheres cease, contact ceases. Contact ceases.

original: pas tshor ba 'gag / tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / sred pa 'gags pas nye bar len pa 'gag / nye bar len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags @185b pas skye ba 'gag / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang mya ngan
analyzed: pas tshor ba 'gag / tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / sred pa 'gags pas nye bar len pa 'gag / nye bar len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag / srid pa 'gags @185b pas skye ba 'gag / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang mya ngan
translated: With the cessation of becoming, birth ceases.üîΩWith the cessation of birth, old age, death,

original: dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: grief, lamentation, pain, mental anguish, and distress cease.üîΩThus, the cessation of this great mass of suffering occurs.

original: de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lugs las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu 'ba' zhig gis sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po rnams 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni lugs las ldog pa'o //
translated: This is the reverse process.

original: de la bden pa bzhi la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de la bden pa bzhi la mi shes pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: In this regard, ignorance is the non-understanding of the four noble truths.

original: lus ngag yid kyi las ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi las ni 'du byed do //
translated: Formative forces are the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi sems ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi sems ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the mind at the time of rebirth.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos ni ming ngo //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos ni ming ngo //
translated: Name is the mental factors associated with the mind at the time of rebirth.

original: mer mer po ni gzugs te ming gzugs so //
analyzed: mer mer po ni gzugs te ming gzugs so //
translated: The kalala is form, and so name-and-form.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched drug ni skye mched drug go //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi skye mched drug ni skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense-spheres of the inner nature are the six sense-spheres.

original: reg pa drug gi tshogs ni reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa drug gi tshogs ni reg pa'o //
translated: The group of six contacts is contact.

original: tshor ba drug gi tshogs ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba drug gi tshogs ni tshor ba'o //
translated: The group of six feelings is feeling.

original: sred pa drug gi tshogs ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa drug gi tshogs ni sred pa'o //
translated: The group of six cravings is craving.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi ni nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi ni nye bar len pa'o //
translated: The four graspings are grasping.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa skyed par byed pa'i las ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa skyed par byed pa'i las ni sred pa'o //
translated: The action that produces the existence of the desire, form, and formless realms is becoming.

original: srid pa rnams su phung po rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa rnams su phung po rnams 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: The arising of the aggregates in the existences is birth.

original: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: phung po yongs su smin pa ni rga ba'o //
translated: The ripening of the aggregates is aging.

original: phung po 'jig pa ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: phung po 'jig pa ni shi ba'o //
translated: The destruction of the aggregates is death.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen las 'du byed nas ci srid du skye ba'i rkyen las rga shi zhes pa 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen las 'du byed nas ci srid du skye ba'i rkyen las rga shi zhes pa 'di gang las she na /
translated: From the condition of ignorance, formations, up to the condition of birth, aging and death, from what is this?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said:

original: 'dir so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa bden pa bzhi la mi shes par gyur pas /
analyzed: 'dir so so skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa bden pa bzhi la mi shes par gyur pas /
translated: Here, an ordinary person who is not learned, being ignorant of the four truths,

original: dus ring po nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gi bar mchog tu 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus ring po nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bdag gi bar mchog tu 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: For a long time, they have been attached to the five aggregates as objects of appropriation as being their self and as being the most excellent.

original: 'di dag ni bdag gi'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bdag gi'o //
translated: These are mine.

original: bdag 'di la'o 'di ni nga'o bdag go zhes lhag par zhen par byed do //
analyzed: bdag 'di la'o 'di ni nga'o bdag go zhes lhag par zhen par byed do //
translated: This is my self. This is my self.

original: de dag de bzhin du srid pa la zhen pas srid par kun du 'byung zhing srid pa'i skye mched la rab tu rtog par byed cing rjes su nyal bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin du srid pa la zhen pas srid par kun du 'byung zhing srid pa'i skye mched la rab tu rtog par byed cing rjes su nyal bar byed do //
translated: In this way, they are attached to existence. They arise in existence. They conceive of the sense bases of existence. They lie down in existence.

original: de dag gi sems pa dang rab tu rtog pa dang bag la nyal de rnams ni dngos po yongs su mi shes pa las byung ba'i srid pa thob pa'i ched du srid pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sems pa dang rab tu rtog pa dang bag la nyal de rnams ni dngos po yongs su mi shes pa las byung ba'i srid pa thob pa'i ched du srid pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Their intentions, conceptions, and proclivities arise from the non-understanding of things. They are established in existence for the sake of attaining existence.

original: rlan can gyi sa la sa bon bzang po btab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rlan can gyi sa la sa bon bzang po btab pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like good seeds planted in moist soil.

original: de la srid pa 'gag pa'i ye shes yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la srid pa 'gag pa'i ye shes yod pa ma yin no //
translated: They do not have the knowledge that puts an end to existence.

original: de'i phyir na ma rig pa'i rkyen las 'du byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na ma rig pa'i rkyen las 'du byed do //
translated: Therefore, due to the condition of ignorance, there are volitions.

original: de dag gi mi shes pas rab tu bskrun pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa des /
analyzed: de dag gi mi shes pas rab tu bskrun pa mngon par 'du byed pa'i sems pa des /
translated: The volition that is produced by their ignorance,

original: srid pa la dga' bas srid par zhugs shing /
analyzed: srid pa la dga' bas srid par zhugs shing /
translated: having entered into existence through delight in existence,

original: srid pa mtshan mar dmigs @186a * //
analyzed: srid pa mtshan mar dmigs @186a * //
translated: and having expanded through the observation of the signs of existence,

original: pa rgyas pas yongs su 'gyur ba'i srid pa dang mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: pa rgyas pas yongs su 'gyur ba'i srid pa dang mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: generates the consciousness that is the transformation of existence and the consciousness that is the link of becoming.

original: de dag gi srid pa nges pa'i sems pa rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi srid pa nges pa'i sems pa rgyun chad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The volition of their existence is not interrupted.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen las rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed kyi rkyen las rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is conditioned by karmic formations.

original: dper na nyi ma med par 'od zer sa la gnas pa'am rgyu ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma med par 'od zer sa la gnas pa'am rgyu ba ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, without the sun, the rays of light do not exist on the ground or in the sky.

original: de kho na bzhin du rnam par shes pa med par ming dang gzugs mngal du 'jug pa 'am 'phel ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rnam par shes pa med par ming dang gzugs mngal du 'jug pa 'am 'phel ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In just the same way, without consciousness, name and form do not enter the womb or grow.

original: na da phung po'i 'thad pa phan tshun brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na da phung po'i 'thad pa phan tshun brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two are established in mutual dependence.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen las ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rkyen las ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Therefore, name and form are conditioned by consciousness.

original: yid kyi skye mched ni dngos po la brten te ming dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba dang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched ni dngos po la brten te ming dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba dang 'jug par byed do //
translated: The mental faculty arises in dependence on a thing, and it arises and functions together with name.

original: gzhan skye mched lnga ni ming dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba chen po la brten te zas dang dus kyi rkyen las skye ba dang 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan skye mched lnga ni ming dang lhan cig tu 'byung ba chen po la brten te zas dang dus kyi rkyen las skye ba dang 'jug par byed do //
translated: The other five sense faculties arise and function in dependence on the great elements that are simultaneous with name. They arise and function due to the conditions of food and time.

original: rkyen de med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen de med par ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not arise and function without these conditions.üîΩTherefore, the six sense bases are conditioned by name and form.

original: de'i phyir ming dang gzugs las skye mched drug go dbang po yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las reg pa skye bas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ming dang gzugs las skye mched drug go dbang po yul dang rnam par shes pa 'dus pa las reg pa skye bas na /
translated: Since contact arises from the union of faculty, object, and consciousness,

original: de'i phyir skye mched drug gi rkyen las reg pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched drug gi rkyen las reg pa'o //
translated: therefore contact is conditioned by the six sense bases.

original: reg nas bde ba'am sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa tshor bar byed do //
analyzed: reg nas bde ba'am sdug bsngal lam sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa tshor bar byed do //
translated: Having contacted, one experiences pleasure, pain, or neither pleasure nor pain.

original: reg pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa med par ma yin no //
translated: One does not experience without contact.

original: de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen las tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg pa'i rkyen las tshor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, feeling is conditioned by contact.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams bde ba nyams su myong bas chags par byas te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams bde ba nyams su myong bas chags par byas te /
translated: Childish ordinary beings, having experienced pleasure, become attached.

original: yang dang yang du de dag don du gnyer bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dang yang du de dag don du gnyer bar byed do //
translated: and again and again one seeks them.

original: sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba na yang sdug bsngal 'joms par byed ba'i bde ba don du gnyer bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba na yang sdug bsngal 'joms par byed ba'i bde ba don du gnyer bar byed do //
translated: When one experiences pain, one seeks the pleasure that will destroy the pain.

original: sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa nyams su myong ba las lhag par zhen nas tshor bar byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal min bde ba min pa nyams su myong ba las lhag par zhen nas tshor bar byed do //
translated: When one experiences neither pain nor pleasure, one clings to that feeling and wants it to last.

original: de'i phyir tshor ba'i rkyen las sred pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshor ba'i rkyen las sred pa'o //
translated: Therefore, craving has the feeling as its condition.

original: zhen pas tshor ba ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: zhen pas tshor ba ni sred pa'o //
translated: Clinging to the feeling is craving.

original: dngos po 'dzin pa brtan bos len par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa brtan bos len par byed do //
translated: One grasps the object firmly.

original: de'i phyir sred pa'i rkyen las len pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sred pa'i rkyen las len pa'o //
translated: Therefore, grasping has craving as its condition.

original: len pa dang bcas pa'i las byas pa rnams srid pa'i sa bon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa dang bcas pa'i las byas pa rnams srid pa'i sa bon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The actions that are done with grasping become the seed of existence.

original: de'i phyir len pa'i rkyen las srid pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir len pa'i rkyen las srid pa'o //
translated: Therefore, existence has grasping as its condition.

original: las kyi bye brag ci lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi bye brag ci lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is born in the various destinies according to the particular karma.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //
translated: Therefore, birth has existence as its condition.

original: skyes pas rgas shing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pas rgas shing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One grows old and dies because of birth.

original: de'i phyir skye ba'i rkyen las rga shi'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba'i rkyen las rga shi'o //
translated: Therefore, old age and death occur due to the condition of birth.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa ni /üîΩdper na spun ma dang sa bon bzhin du ma @186b rig pa 'du byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa ni / dper na spun ma dang sa bon bzhin du ma @186b rig pa 'du byed do //
translated: Moreover, the conception is as follows:üîΩLike a winnowing fan and grain, ignorance is the formative forces.

original: dpar gnas bon dang myu gu bzhin du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dpar gnas bon dang myu gu bzhin du byed dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Like a seed and a sprout, the formative forces are consciousness.

original: dper na myu gu dang 'dab ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: dper na myu gu dang 'dab ma bzhin du rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs so //
translated: Like a sprout and a leaf, consciousness is name and form.

original: dper na 'dab ma dang sdong po bzhin du ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
analyzed: dper na 'dab ma dang sdong po bzhin du ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
translated: Like a leaf and a trunk, name and form are the six sense bases.

original: dper na sdong bo dang yal ga bzhin du skye mched drug dang reg pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sdong bo dang yal ga bzhin du skye mched drug dang reg pa'o //
translated: Like a trunk and branches, the six sense bases are contact.

original: dper na yal ga dang me tog bzhin du reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
analyzed: dper na yal ga dang me tog bzhin du reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
translated: Like branches and flowers, contact is feeling.

original: dper na me tog dang gong bu bzhin du tshor ba dang sred pa'o //üîΩdper na gong bu dang 'bras bu bzhin du sred pa dang len pa'o //
analyzed: dper na me tog dang gong bu bzhin du tshor ba dang sred pa'o // dper na gong bu dang 'bras bu bzhin du sred pa dang len pa'o //
translated: Like flowers and fruit, feeling is craving.üîΩLike fruit and seeds, craving is grasping.

original: dper na 'bras bu dang sa bon bzhin du nye bar len pa dang srid pa'o//
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu dang sa bon bzhin du nye bar len pa dang srid pa'o//
translated: Like seeds and sprouts, grasping is existence.

original: dper na sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du srid pa dang skye ba'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang myu gu bzhin du srid pa dang skye ba'o //
translated: Existence and birth are like the seed and the sprout.

original: rkyen las zhes pa kun la blta'o //
analyzed: rkyen las zhes pa kun la blta'o //
translated: The condition should be understood in all cases.

original: dper na de ltar sa bon gyi rgyun 'jug pa'i sngon gyi mtha' shes par bya ba nyid ma yin zhing phyi ma'i mtha' shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na de ltar sa bon gyi rgyun 'jug pa'i sngon gyi mtha' shes par bya ba nyid ma yin zhing phyi ma'i mtha' shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: For example, the continuum of the seed is not to be understood as having a beginning or an end.

original: de kho na bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyun rab tu 'jug pa ni sngon gyi mtha' shes par bya ba nyid de ma yin zhing phyi ma'i mtha' shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyun rab tu 'jug pa ni sngon gyi mtha' shes par bya ba nyid de ma yin zhing phyi ma'i mtha' shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the continuum of dependent origination, beginning with ignorance, is not to be understood as having a beginning or an end.

original: de nas ma rig pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nas ma rig pa'i rkyen gang zhe na /
translated: What is the condition of ignorance?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said:

original: ma rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid do //
translated: ignorance itself.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen las bag la nyal lo //üîΩkun nas ldang ba'i rkyen bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen las bag la nyal lo // kun nas ldang ba'i rkyen bag la nyal lo //
translated: The condition of ignorance is the latent tendencies.üîΩThe condition of the manifest is the latent tendencies.

original: bag la nyal gyi rkyen ni kun nas ldang ba'o //üîΩsngon ma'i rkyen sngon ma'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi rkyen ni kun nas ldang ba'o // sngon ma'i rkyen sngon ma'o //
translated: The condition of the latent tendencies is the manifest.üîΩThe condition of the past is the past.

original: phyi ma'i rkyen phyi ma'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i rkyen phyi ma'o //
translated: The condition of the future is the future.

original: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rkyen du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad rkyen du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Or else, all the defilements are conditions.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: zag pa kun du 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun du 'byung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: zag pa kun du 'byung ba las ma rig pa kun du 'byung ngo zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the arising of the defilements, there is the arising of ignorance.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang / sems gcig pa'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems gcig pa'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the method of a single thought is as follows:

original: dus gang gi tshe byis pa rnams mig gi gzugs mthong ba na 'dod chags skye ste /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe byis pa rnams mig gi gzugs mthong ba na 'dod chags skye ste /
translated: Whenever fools see a form with the eye, attachment arises.

original: mdzes pa bde ba'o zhes sems kun du rmongs pa 'dis ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa bde ba'o zhes sems kun du rmongs pa 'dis ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeautiful, pleasant!‚Äù‚Äîthis is the confusion of the mind, which is ignorance.

original: ma rig pas rab tu skyed pa'i lus la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba 'di ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pas rab tu skyed pa'i lus la sogs pa yongs su g-yo ba 'di ni 'du byed do //
translated: The movement of the body, etc. , generated by ignorance is the karmic forces.

original: chags ba'i sems ni 'du byed kyi rkyen las rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: chags ba'i sems ni 'du byed kyi rkyen las rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The mind of attachment is consciousness conditioned by the karmic forces.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang des kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen las ming dang gzugs so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sems las byung ba dang des kun nas bslang ba'i gzugs ni rnam par shes pa'i rkyen las ming dang gzugs so //
translated: The form that is associated with that mind and is projected by it is name-and-form conditioned by consciousness.

original: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i rkyen dga' ba dang / dga' ba las skyes pa'i rkyen gzugs dag gi dbang po @187a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags las skyes pa'i rkyen dga' ba dang / dga' ba las skyes pa'i rkyen gzugs dag gi dbang po @187a * //
translated: The condition of delight born from attachment and the condition of form born from delight are the condition for the six sense bases.

original: rnams kyi rab tu dang ba ma yin pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las skye mched drug go //
analyzed: rnams kyi rab tu dang ba ma yin pa ni ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las skye mched drug go //
translated: The lack of clarity of the faculties of form is the condition for the six sense bases.

original: ma rig pa 'dus te reg pa ni skye mched drug gi rkyen las reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'dus te reg pa ni skye mched drug gi rkyen las reg pa'o //
translated: The contact that arises from the coming together of ignorance is the condition for contact.

original: de'i tshe gang yang bde ba de ni reg pa'i rkyen las tshor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang yang bde ba de ni reg pa'i rkyen las tshor ba'o //
translated: At that time, whatever is pleasant is the condition for feeling.

original: de'i tshe 'dod chag pa ni tshor ba'i rkyen las sred pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dod chag pa ni tshor ba'i rkyen las sred pa'o //
translated: At that time, attachment is the condition for craving.

original: chags pas mdzes pa dang bde bar 'dzin pa ni sred pa'i rkyen las len pa'o //
analyzed: chags pas mdzes pa dang bde bar 'dzin pa ni sred pa'i rkyen las len pa'o //
translated: Attachment to beauty and pleasure is the condition for grasping.

original: de'i tshe chags pa'i sems pa ni len pa'i rkyen las srid pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe chags pa'i sems pa ni len pa'i rkyen las srid pa'o //
translated: At that time, the intention of attachment is the condition for becoming.

original: chos de rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa ni srid pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //
analyzed: chos de rnams mngon par sgrub par byed pa ni srid pa'i rkyen las skye ba'o //
translated: The actualization of those phenomena is the condition for birth.

original: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni rga ba'o //
translated: The transformation of the state is aging.

original: skad cig 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig 'jig pa ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Momentary destruction is death.

original: de kho na bzhin du rim gyis skad cig gcig gis yan lag bcu gnyis mnyam du rgyu bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du rim gyis skad cig gcig gis yan lag bcu gnyis mnyam du rgyu bar shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the twelve members occur simultaneously in a single moment.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de rnams ni rgol ba bcu dang / lan bcus grub po //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis de rnams ni rgol ba bcu dang / lan bcus grub po //
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination are established by ten objections and ten answers.

original: de la rgol ba bcu ni 'di lta ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa du dang / lus du dang / rnam par smin pa du dang / 'das pa du dang / ma 'ongs pa du dang / de ltar ba du dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos gang zhe na dang /
analyzed: de la rgol ba bcu ni 'di lta ste / nyon mongs pa du dang / lus du dang / rnam par smin pa du dang / 'das pa du dang / ma 'ongs pa du dang / de ltar ba du dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos gang zhe na dang /
translated: The ten objections are:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dag tha dad pa'i rgyu ci dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i zab mo nyid gang zhe na'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos dag tha dad pa'i rgyu ci dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i zab mo nyid gang zhe na'o //
translated: How many members are afflictions, how many are actions, and how many are sufferings? How many are afflictions and actions, and how many are only sufferings? How many are afflictions and actions, and how many are only sufferings? How many are past, how many are future, and how many are present? How many are internal and how many are external? What is dependent origination and what are the dharmas that arise dependently? What is the difference between dependent origination and the dharmas that arise dependently? What is the profundity of dependent origination?

original: grangs bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The answers are given in order.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni yan lag gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa ni yan lag gsum ste /
translated: Thus, three members are afflictions.

original: 'di ltar / ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / nye bar len pa'o //
translated: Thus, ignorance, craving, and grasping are the three afflictions.

original: yan lag gnyis ni las te 'di ltar /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis ni las te 'di ltar /
translated: Two members are karma:

original: 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
translated: formations and becoming.

original: yan lag bdun ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag bdun ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: Seven members are the results of evolution:

original: 'di ltar / yan lag lhag ma rnams so //üîΩde la ri mo'i las la mtshon byed pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar / yan lag lhag ma rnams so // de la ri mo'i las la mtshon byed pa'i rigs pas /
translated: the remaining members.

original: nyon mongs pa ni yang srid sgrub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩri mor byed pa'i 'thad pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni yang srid sgrub pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no // ri mor byed pa'i 'thad pas /
translated: In this regard, the afflictions are the cause for the production of future existence, as in the case of the artist.

original: las ni dman pa dang gya nom pa tha dad pa byed pa yin no //üîΩbris pa'i gzugs kyi rigs pas /
analyzed: las ni dman pa dang gya nom pa tha dad pa byed pa yin no // bris pa'i gzugs kyi rigs pas /
translated: Karma is the cause for the differentiation of good and bad destinies, as in the case of the designer.

original: rnam par smin pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa mngon par grub pa yod pa'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni las dang nyon mongs pa mngon par grub pa yod pa'i rkyen gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: The results of evolution are the actualization of karma and the afflictions, as in the case of the painted canvas.

original: yan lag gnyis ni 'das pa ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yan lag gnyis ni 'das pa ste 'di ltar /
translated: Two members are in the past:

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: ignorance and formations.

original: gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Two are in the future:

original: 'di ltar / skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / skye ba dang / rga shi'o //
translated: birth and old age and death.

original: brgyad ni da ltar pa ste /üîΩde @187b 'di ltar /
analyzed: brgyad ni da ltar pa ste /üîΩde @187b 'di ltar /
translated: Eight are in the present:üîΩconsciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, birth, and old age and death.

original: lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The rest are the remaining members.

original: dus gsum bzung ba 'dis ni thog ma dang ta ma med pa 'khor ba'i lam rjes su 'brel bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum bzung ba 'dis ni thog ma dang ta ma med pa 'khor ba'i lam rjes su 'brel bar bstan pa'o //
translated: By this retention of the three times, the path of cyclic existence is shown to be without beginning or end.

original: gang yan lag bcu gnyis de rnams ni rim pa bzhin du phan tshun rgyu nyid dang / byed po nyid dang / phan 'dogs pa nyid dang / 'di ni rten nyid do zhes pa 'di ni rten cing 'brel pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang yan lag bcu gnyis de rnams ni rim pa bzhin du phan tshun rgyu nyid dang / byed po nyid dang / phan 'dogs pa nyid dang / 'di ni rten nyid do zhes pa 'di ni rten cing 'brel pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: The twelve members are respectively the cause, the agent, the benefit, and the basis.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The Dharma of dependent origination has twelve members.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di ni 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin /
translated: This dependent origination should not be described as a transformation of the formations that is not complete.

original: 'dus byas zhes brjod bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes brjod bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: It should not be described as conditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It should not be described as unconditioned.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos ni /
translated: The Dharma of dependent origination

original: 'du byed yongs su rdzogs pa 'dus byas so zhes pa 'di ni da dag gi tha dad pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed yongs su rdzogs pa 'dus byas so zhes pa 'di ni da dag gi tha dad pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The complete assemblage of the formative forces is the conditioned.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa dang mtshan nyid gang gis ma rig pa 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang mtshan nyid de dag dang rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag 'phags pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi spyan gyis mngon du mkhyen to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa dang mtshan nyid gang gis ma rig pa 'du byed kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de dang mtshan nyid de dag dang rkyen gzhan dang gzhan dag 'phags pa rnams kyi shes rab kyi spyan gyis mngon du mkhyen to //
translated: The aspects and characteristics by which ignorance is a condition for the formative forces are directly perceived by the eye of wisdom of the Noble Ones, as are the other conditions.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la'o //
translated: This is so for all the other links.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i zab pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i zab pa nyid do //
translated: This is the profundity of dependent origination.

original: phyogs gzhan ni /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan ni /
translated: Another aspect is as follows:

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di dag rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di dag rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
translated: This dependent origination should be seen in seven ways:

original: 'di ltar / mtshams gsum dang / mdor bsdus pa bzhi dang / rnam pa nyi shu dang / 'khor lo dang / tshul lugs dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mtshams gsum dang / mdor bsdus pa bzhi dang / rnam pa nyi shu dang / 'khor lo dang / tshul lugs dang / rnam par dbye ba dang / bsdu ba'o //
translated: as threefold connection, as four summations, as twenty aspects, as a wheel, as a stream, as a discrimination, and as a collection.

original: de la mtshams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: de la mtshams ni gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the threefold connection is as follows:

original: 'di ltar / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar ni mtshams dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i bar ni mtshams dang po'o //
translated: formations and consciousness are the first link.

original: tshor ba dang sred pa'i bar ni mtshams gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang sred pa'i bar ni mtshams gnyis pa'o //
translated: Sensation and craving are the second link.

original: srid pa dang skye ba'i bar ni mtshams gsum pa'o //üîΩde la 'das pa'i ldas dang nyon mongs pa ni da ltar byi rnam pa smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams dang po'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang skye ba'i bar ni mtshams gsum pa'o // de la 'das pa'i ldas dang nyon mongs pa ni da ltar byi rnam pa smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams dang po'o //
translated: Becoming and birth are the third link.üîΩThe karma and afflictions of the past are the condition of ripening in the present, which is the first link.

original: da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa ni da ltar gyi rnams par smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams gnyid pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa ni da ltar gyi rnams par smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams gnyid pa'o //
translated: The karma and afflictions of the present are the condition of ripening in the present, which is the second link.

original: da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen te mtshams gsum pa'o //
translated: The karma and afflictions of the present are the condition of ripening in the future, which is the third link.

original: yang na dang po dang gsum pa ni rgyu 'bras kyi mtshams so //
analyzed: yang na dang po dang gsum pa ni rgyu 'bras kyi mtshams so //
translated: Alternatively, the first and third are the links of cause and effect.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshams so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshams so //
translated: The second is the link of the effect.

original: srid pa'i mtshams ni med do //
analyzed: srid pa'i mtshams ni med do //
translated: There is no link of existence.

original: srid pa'i mtshams zhes par dan ci zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i mtshams zhes par dan ci zhe na /
translated: What is the link of existence?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be explained as follows.

original: shi nas de ma thag tu 'pho ba @188a * //
analyzed: shi nas de ma thag tu 'pho ba @188a * //
translated: The aggregates, bases, and elements that are not immediately transferred after death are the establishment of existence.

original: ma yin pa'i phung po skye mched khams rnams la yang srid mngon par grub pa 'di ni srid pa'i mtshams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phung po skye mched khams rnams la yang srid mngon par grub pa 'di ni srid pa'i mtshams zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the link of existence.

original: srid pa'i mtshams de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i mtshams de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the link of existence occur?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag ma rig par gyur pa sred pa dang ldan pa bsod nams dang sdig pa bsags pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo de dag ma rig par gyur pa sred pa dang ldan pa bsod nams dang sdig pa bsags pa ste /
translated: Those childish ordinary beings, ignorant and craving, accumulate merit and demerit.

original: gang gi tshe 'di nyid 'chi ba'i mtha' can gyi tshor bas zil gyis mnan cing 'chi ba la lhag par ma nye ba de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di nyid 'chi ba'i mtha' can gyi tshor bas zil gyis mnan cing 'chi ba la lhag par ma nye ba de'i tshe 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they are overwhelmed by the feelings that end in death and are not close to death, then this occurs.

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten 'di mi mthong zhing rmongs pas dran pa mi rnyed par gyur bzhin pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten 'di mi mthong zhing rmongs pas dran pa mi rnyed par gyur bzhin pa na /
translated: Thus, while not seeing this world and being confused, they do not regain mindfulness.

original: tshor bas non cing dran pa dang blo gros yongs su nyams /
analyzed: tshor bas non cing dran pa dang blo gros yongs su nyams /
translated: Overcome by feelings, their mindfulness and intelligence are completely impaired.

original: lus kyi stobs dang nus pa yongs su nyams /
analyzed: lus kyi stobs dang nus pa yongs su nyams /
translated: The strength and ability of their body are completely impaired.

original: dbang po rnams nye bar 'gags /
analyzed: dbang po rnams nye bar 'gags /
translated: Their faculties cease.

original: ta la'i la ma skams pa bzhin du lus kyi mtha' gnyis nas srog gi dbang po nye bar skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ta la'i la ma skams pa bzhin du lus kyi mtha' gnyis nas srog gi dbang po nye bar skams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Like a palm tree whose roots have been cut, the life faculty dries up from the two ends of the body.

original: de'i tshe de'i rmi lam du gyur pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rmi lam du gyur pa bzhin du /
translated: At that time, as if in a dream,

original: las kyi chos bzhi nye bar gnas par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: las kyi chos bzhi nye bar gnas par 'gyur te ;
translated: four phenomena related to karma will appear.üîΩNamely,

original: 'chi ba ni 'tsho ba dang bral ba ste /

analyzed: mya ngan ni sdug bsngal du son pa'i sems yongs su 'chang ba'o //

analyzed: de ni nang dang phyi rol sred par byed pa'i don gyis na sdug bsngal lo //

original: sdug bsngal ni lus kyi ste /

analyzed: de ni lus yongs su mnar ba'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo // yid mi bde @191a * //

original: ba ni sems kyi sdug bsngal te /

original: sems yongs su gzir bar byed pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sems yongs su gzir bar byed pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: 'khrug ngal ni sdug bsngal du 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa rgyas pa ste /

analyzed: de ni kun du rmongs par byed pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa ni mi 'dod pa'i sems can gyi 'du byed dang mnyam du 'tshogs pa ste /

analyzed: de sdug bsngal byed pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba ni 'dod pa'i sems pa can gyi 'du byed dang bral ba ste /

analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don par byed pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: de yang bsam pa nyams pa'i don gyis sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: yang sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum ni 'di ltar /

analyzed: kun 'byung 'di 'gags pas sdug bsngal 'di 'gag go zhes gsum pa 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: The third, cessation, is taught, because of the cessation of this origination, suffering ceases.

original: 'di ni kun 'byung 'gog pa'i thabs so zhes bzhi pa lam gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni kun 'byung 'gog pa'i thabs so zhes bzhi pa lam gyi bden pa bstan to //

original: dper na sman pa mkhas pas dang po nad shes par byed /
analyzed: dper na sman pa mkhas pas dang po nad shes par byed /

analyzed: de nas nad kyi rgyu yongs su tshol ba dang / de nas nad byang ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i sman ston pa'o //

analyzed: de kho na bzhin du ci ltar nad de ltar sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: ci ltar na nad byang ba de bzhin du 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: ci ltar sman de bzhin du lam du blta bar bya'o //

original: mdor bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba ni /

analyzed: 'jug pa ni sdug bsngal lo //

original: 'jug par byed pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ni kun 'byung ngo //

original: ldog pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa ni 'gog pa'o //

original: ldog par byed pa ni lam mo //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa ni lam mo //

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po ni sdug bsngal lo //

original: nyon mongs pa ni kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni kun 'byung ngo //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs ni lam mo //

analyzed: kun 'byung rnam par bzhag pa ni chad pa'i lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa'i sgo'o //

analyzed: lam rnam par bzhag pa ni bya ba ma yin pa'i lta ba yang dag par 'joms pa'i sgo'o //

original: dper bya ba ni /
analyzed: dper bya ba ni /

analyzed: dper na dug gi sdong po bzhin du sdug bsngal blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: dper na tshu rol du dogs pa dang bcas pa dang 'jigs pa dang bcas pa bzhin du sdug bsngal blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: dper na chu bo bzhin du kun 'byung ngo //

analyzed: dper na pha rol 'gram na 'jigs pa med pa bzhin du 'gog pa'o //

original: dper na gru bzhin du lam du lta'o //
analyzed: dper na gru bzhin du lam du lta'o //

analyzed: dper na khur khur ba bzhin du sdug bsngal blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: dper na khur bor ba'i thabs bzhin du lam blta @193b bar bya'o //

original: rnam par dbye ba zhes pa ni bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba zhes pa ni bden pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar ngag bden pa dang / so sor bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //

analyzed: de la bden pa kho na smra zhing mi bden pa ni ma yin no zhes pa ni ngag bden pa'o //

analyzed: de ni dge slong gang brdzun dang rmongs pa'i chos de dag ni mi bden pa'o //

analyzed: gang rmongs pa med pa'i chos de ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //

analyzed: bsdom par bya ba ni srid pa ma gtogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa gsum gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung ma bstan gyi chos rnams ni sdug bsngal bden pa'o //

analyzed: sred pa ni kun 'byung bden pa'o //

analyzed: sred pa spangs pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa'o //

original: tshul gzhan yang /
analyzed: tshul gzhan yang /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni lam gyi bden pa'o //

original: yang tshul gzhan /

analyzed: sred pa dang  lhag ma'i nyon mongs pa dang mi dge ba thams cad ma gtogs te /

analyzed: sa gsum gyi lung ma bstan gyi chos ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa spangs pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o // lam @194a * //

analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i don gyis dang srid pa kun du sbyor ba'i don gyis mi dge ba thams cad ni kun 'byung ngo //

original: srid pa skyed pa'i don gyis sa gsum gyi dge ba'i chos rnams kun 'byung ngo //üîΩdes na sred pa dang lhag ma nyon mongs pa dang mi dge ba thams cad dang sa gsum gyi dge ba rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden par 'gyur te /

translated: The wholesome dharmas of the three realms are the truth of origination because they are the cause of the origination of existence.

original: mnar ba dang kun du gdung ba dang 'dus byas dang yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsred pa la sogs pa de nyid kun 'byung gi bden par 'gyur te /

analyzed: sdud par byed pa dang len pa dang spags pa kun du sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal bden pa dang / kun 'byung bden pa'o //

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: bden pa gsum ni 'dus byas so //

original: 'gog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni 'dus ma byas so //

analyzed: mthar chags kyis rgyas par bshad pa ni //

analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal spangs pa na 'gog pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ni /

analyzed: ming dang gzugs dag ni sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: de dag spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //

translated: This is called the end of suffering.

original: des na brjod de /üîΩrigs kyi tshor bas 'bar ba yi //
analyzed: des na brjod de / rigs kyi tshor bas 'bar ba yi //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe mass of iron burns with the fire of its own family,

original: lcags kyi gong bu nyams pa nyid //
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu nyams pa nyid //
translated: and it is consumed.

original: rim gyis nye bar zhi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: rim gyis nye bar zhi 'gyur gyi //
translated: It gradually becomes extinguished,

original: 'gro ba shes par bya min ltar //
analyzed: 'gro ba shes par bya min ltar //
translated: but the world is not known to be so.

original: de bzhin 'dod pa'i 'dam klung la //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod pa'i 'dam klung la //
translated: In the same way, in the mire of desire,

original: bgal zhing yang dag rnam grol gyi //üîΩmi g-yo go 'phang thob rnams kyis //
analyzed: bgal zhing yang dag rnam grol gyi // mi g-yo go 'phang thob rnams kyis //
translated: one is entangled and completely liberated,üîΩbut the one who has attained the immovable stage

original: gshegs pa gdugs su nges par med //
analyzed: gshegs pa gdugs su nges par med //
translated: does not necessarily go to the heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: de'i phyir / 'phags pa'i sa la gnyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'phags pa'i sa la gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the noble stages are twofold:

original: de la mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
translated: The stage of seeing is the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: lhag ma lam gsum dang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhin ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lhag ma lam gsum dang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhin ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The remaining three paths and the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner are the path of cultivation.

original: de la lam gsum ni /
analyzed: de la lam gsum ni /
translated: Here, the three paths are:

original: 'di ltar / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
translated: Thus, the path of the fruit of once-returner, the path of the fruit of non-returner, and the path of the fruit of arhatship.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The four fruits of the religious life are as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the fruit of arhatship.

original: de la sngon ma mthong ba'i bden pa mthong ba mthong @199b ba'i sa dang / ci ltar mthong ba de ltar bsgoms pas bsgom pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de la sngon ma mthong ba'i bden pa mthong ba mthong @199b ba'i sa dang / ci ltar mthong ba de ltar bsgoms pas bsgom pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of seeing is the first direct realization of the truths that have not been seen before. The stage of cultivation is the cultivation of the path in the manner in which it has been seen.

original: yang sa gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang sa gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: There are two other stages:

original: slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i sa dang / mi slob pa'i sa'o //
translated: the stage of the spiritually immature and the stage of the spiritually mature.

original: de la lam bzhi dang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum ni slob pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de la lam bzhi dang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum ni slob pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the spiritually immature is the four paths and the three fruits of the religious life.

original: de la lam bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la lam bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: The four paths are as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i lam dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam mo //
translated: the path of the fruit of entering the stream, the path of the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the path of the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and the path of the fruit of arhatship.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: The three fruits of the spiritual practitioner are the fruit of the stream-enterer, the fruit of the once-returner, and the fruit of the non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni mi slob pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu ni mi slob pa'i sa'o //
translated: The fruit of the arhat is the stage of no more learning.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po gsum ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbang po gsum ni 'di ltar /
translated: The three supramundane faculties are as follows:

original: mi shes pa kun shes par 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa nyid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par 'gyur ba'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa nyid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of the understanding of what has not been understood, the faculty of understanding, and the faculty of the state of having understood.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the path of the fruit of stream-enterer is

original: sngon ma shes pa'i chos shes pas mi shes pa kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: sngon ma shes pa'i chos shes pas mi shes pa kun shes pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of the understanding of what has not been understood, because it is the understanding of phenomena that have not been understood previously.

original: lam gsum gyi ye shes dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum gyi ye shes ni kun shes pa'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: lam gsum gyi ye shes dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu gsum gyi ye shes ni kun shes pa'i dbang po ste /
translated: The knowledge of the three paths and the knowledge of the three fruits of the spiritual practitioner is the faculty of understanding,

original: shes pa'i chos rnams shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i chos rnams shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the understanding of phenomena that have been understood.

original: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The knowledge of the arhat is

original: chos rnams lhag ma med par shes pas kun shes pa nyid kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: chos rnams lhag ma med par shes pas kun shes pa nyid kyi dbang po'o //
translated: the faculty of the state of having understood, because it is the understanding of all phenomena without exception.

original: rnam par grol ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Liberation is threefold:üîΩthe door of liberation of signlessness,üîΩthe door of liberation of wishlessness,

original: 'di ltar / mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mtshan ma med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: and the door of liberation of emptiness.

original: de la lam dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes pas mtshan mar mi byed pas mtshan mar mi byed pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: de la lam dang yang dag par ldan pa'i shes pas mtshan mar mi byed pas mtshan mar mi byed pa ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: The door of liberation of signlessness is the non-performance of signs by means of the knowledge that is endowed with the path.

original: smon pa mi byed pa ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: smon pa mi byed pa ni smon pa med pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: The door of liberation of wishlessness is the non-performance of wishes.

original: mngon par zhen pa mi byed pa ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa mi byed pa ni stong pa nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: The door of liberation of emptiness is the non-performance of firm grasping.

original: rnam par thar pa'i dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo dag tha dad pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo dag tha dad pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the difference between liberation and the doors of liberation?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It is said:

original: lam shes pa de nyid nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba ni rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: lam shes pa de nyid nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba ni rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: That very knowledge of the path is liberation from the defilements.

original: ye shes de nyid bdud rtsi'i sgor gyur pa'i don gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid bdud rtsi'i sgor gyur pa'i don gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo'o //
translated: That very intuition is the door of liberation in the sense of being the door of nectar.

original: lam gsum gyis nyon mongs pa nyi shu spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lam gsum gyis nyon mongs pa nyi shu spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: By means of the three paths, the twenty afflictions are abandoned.

original: 'di ltar / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / 'dod tshol dang / zag pa dang / mdud pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye @200a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / 'dod tshol dang / zag pa dang / mdud pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye @200a * //
translated: Thus, the roots of nonvirtue, the searches, the contaminations, the knots, the floods, the bonds, the clingings, the wrong paths,

original: bar len pa dang / 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / ser sna dang / sgrib pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi dang / bag la nyal dang / 'jig rten gyi chos dang / nga rgyal dang / nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang /
analyzed: bar len pa dang / 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / ser sna dang / sgrib pa dang / rtsod pa'i gzhi dang / bag la nyal dang / 'jig rten gyi chos dang / nga rgyal dang / nyon mongs pa'i dngos po dang /
translated: miserliness, the obscurations, the bases of contention, the proclivities, the worldly concerns, pride, the things of affliction,

original: mi dge ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / log pa nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / mi dge bar sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang / log pa nyid dang / phyin ci log dang / mi dge bar sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: nonvirtue, the fetters, the wrongnesses, the inversions, and the generation of a nonvirtuous mind.

original: de la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, there are three roots of nonvirtue:

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / rmongs pa'o //
translated: attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: 'di rnams la gang zhe sdang ni lam gnyis kyis srab par byas te /
analyzed: 'di rnams la gang zhe sdang ni lam gnyis kyis srab par byas te /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis lhag ma med pa'i spong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩchags pa dang gti mug ni lam gsum gyis srab par byas te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis lhag ma med pa'i spong bar 'gyur ro // chags pa dang gti mug ni lam gsum gyis srab par byas te /
translated: Hatred is weakened by two paths, and is completely abandoned by the path of the non-returner.

original: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Attachment and delusion are weakened by three paths, and are completely abandoned by the path of the perfected being.

original: 'dod tshol la gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'dod tshol la gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are three kinds of search:

original: 'dod pa'i tshol ba dang / srid pa'i tshol ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i tshol ba dang / srid pa'i tshol ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i tshol ba'o //
translated: search for desire, search for existence, and search for brahmic practices.

original: de la tshangs par spyod pa'i tshol ba ni /
analyzed: de la tshangs par spyod pa'i tshol ba ni /
translated: Search for brahmic practices

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong ngo //
translated: is completely abandoned by the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'dod pa'i tshol ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i tshol ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: Search for desire is abandoned by the path of the non-returner.

original: srid pa'i tshol ba ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: srid pa'i tshol ba ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: Search for existence is abandoned by the path of the perfected being.

original: zag pa la bzhi ste /
analyzed: zag pa la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of defilements:

original: 'di ltar / 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: the asava of sensuality, the asava of existence, the asava of views, and the asava of ignorance.

original: de la lta ba'i zag pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ngo //üîΩ'dod pa'i zag pa ni /
analyzed: de la lta ba'i zag pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ngo // 'dod pa'i zag pa ni /
translated: The asava of views is eliminated by the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The asava of sensuality is eliminated by the path of the fruit of non-return.

original: srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa dang ma rig pa'i zag pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //
translated: The asava of existence and the asava of ignorance are eliminated by the path of the fruit of arhatship.

original: mdud pa ni bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: mdud pa ni bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are four knots:

original: brnab sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang ; gnod sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / 'di ni bden zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang ; gnod sems kyi tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang / 'di ni bden zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of the accumulation of covetousness, the knot of the accumulation of ill will, the knot of the accumulation of adherence to particular views, and the knot of the accumulation of adherence to particular observances and rituals.

original: 'di rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang 'di ni bden pa zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams la tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa dang 'di ni bden pa zhes mngon par zhen pa'i tshogs kyi mdud pa ni /
translated: The knots of the aggregates of holding discipline and ritual as paramount and the knots of the aggregates of clinging to ‚Äúthis is true‚Äù areüîΩ

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ngo //
translated: The fetter of the group of the overesteeming of morality and ritual as supreme and the fetter of the group of the overesteeming of bad views are abandoned by the path of the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: gnod sems tshogs kyi mdud pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: gnod sems tshogs kyi mdud pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The fetter of the group of malice is abandoned by the path of the fruit of nonreturner.

original: brnab sems tshogs kyi mdud pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: brnab sems tshogs kyi mdud pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //
translated: The fetter of the group of covetousness is abandoned by the path of the fruit of arhat.

original: chu bo la bzhi ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: chu bo la bzhi ni 'di ltar /
translated: There are four floods:

original: @200b 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: @200b 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: the flood of desire, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.

original: sbyor ba la bzhi ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba la bzhi ni /
translated: There are four bonds:

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩ'di rnams ni zag pa bzhi bzhin du spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o // 'di rnams ni zag pa bzhi bzhin du spong ba'o //
translated: the bond of desire, the bond of existence, the bond of views, and the bond of ignorance.üîΩThese are abandoned in the same way as the four defilements.

original: nye bar len pa bzhin ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhin ni 'di ltar /
translated: There are four clingings:

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs nye bar len pa dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa'o //
translated: and the appropriation of the claim to be superior.

original: 'di rnams la nye bar len pa gnyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams la nye bar len pa gnyis ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis spong ba'o //
translated: Two of these are eliminated by the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The appropriation of desire is eliminated by the path of the fruit of non-returner.

original: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The appropriation of the claim to be superior is eliminated by the path of the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of non-going:üîΩnon-going due to desire,üîΩnon-going due to hatred,üîΩnon-going due to fear, and

original: 'di ltar / 'dun pa las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / zhe sdang las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / 'jigs pa las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / gti mug las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dun pa las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / zhe sdang las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / 'jigs pa las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa dang / gti mug las 'gro ba ma yin par bgrod pa'o //
translated: non-going due to delusion.

original: bzhi ka yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus spong ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi ka yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bus spong ba'o //
translated: All four are eliminated by the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ser sna la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ser sna la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are five kinds of stinginess:

original: gnas kyi ser sna dang / rigs kyi ser sna dang / rnyed pa'i ser sna dang / bsngags pa'i ser sna dang / chos kyi ser sna'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi ser sna dang / rigs kyi ser sna dang / rnyed pa'i ser sna dang / bsngags pa'i ser sna dang / chos kyi ser sna'o //
translated: stinginess about dwellings, stinginess about family, stinginess about possessions, stinginess about praise, and stinginess about the Dharma.

original: thams cad ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis spong ngo //
translated: All of these are abandoned by the path of the non-returner.

original: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five hindrances:

original: 'di ltar / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod 'gyod dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod 'gyod dang / the tshom mo //
translated: desire for sense objects, malice, torpor and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: 'di rnams la /
analyzed: 'di rnams la /
translated: Among these,

original: the tshom ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis spong ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis spong ba'o //
translated: doubt is abandoned by the path of the stream-enterer.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang 'gyod pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang 'gyod pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Desire for sense objects, malice, and regret are completely abandoned by the path of the non-returner.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: Torpor and sleep, and excitation, are abandoned by the path of the arhat.

original: gnyis rtsod pa'i gzhi la drug ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: gnyis rtsod pa'i gzhi la drug ste 'di ltar /

analyzed: khro ba dang / 'chab pa dang / phrag dog dang / g-yo dang / sdig pa'i 'dod pa dang / rang nyid kyi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //

original: khro ba dang 'chab pa dang / phrag dog ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: khro ba dang 'chab pa dang / phrag dog ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

original: bag la nyal ba la bdun ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba la bdun ni 'di ltar /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal dang / khong khro bag la nyal dang / @201a * //

analyzed: 'di rnams la lta ba'i bag la nyal dang the tshom bag la nyal ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis rab tu spong ba'o ;
translated: The latent tendencies of the view and the latent tendencies of doubt are completely eliminated by the path of the result of stream entry.

analyzed: /'dod pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal dang khong khro bag la nyal dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ba'o //

analyzed: nga rgyal bag la nyal dang srid pa'i 'dod chags bag la nyal dang ma rig pa bag la nyal ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

original: 'jig rten chos brgyad ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'jig rten chos brgyad ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: The eight worldly dharmas are as follows:

original: rnyed pa dang / ma thob pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / smod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / ma thob pa dang / snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / smod pa dang / bstod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal lo //

analyzed: 'di rnams la mi 'dod pa'i dngos po rnyed pa la sogs pa la zhe sdang ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis spong ba'o //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i dngos po rnyed pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ba'o //

analyzed: nga rgyal la dgu ni 'di lta ste /

original: nga ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni mnyam pa las dman pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni dman pa las mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni dman pa dang mnyam mo snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
analyzed: nga ni mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni mnyam pa las dman pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni dman pa las mchog go snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga ni dman pa dang mnyam mo snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang /
translated: pride thinking ‚ÄúI am equal to the superior,‚Äù pride thinking ‚ÄúI am inferior to the equal,‚Äù pride thinking ‚ÄúI am superior to the inferior,‚Äù pride thinking ‚ÄúI am equal to the inferior,‚Äù

original: nga ni dman pa las dman pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga ni dman pa las dman pa'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and pride thinking ‚ÄúI am inferior to the equal.‚Äù

analyzed: nga rgyal dgu char yang dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The nine types of pride are completely abandoned by the path of the arhat.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la bcu ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po la bcu ni 'di ltar /
translated: The ten things that are objects of affliction are as follows:

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang / ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa'o //

analyzed: 'di rnams la lta ba dang the tshom dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

analyzed: zhe sdang ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //

original: lhag ma bdun ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: lhag ma bdun ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

original: mnar sems kyi dngos po ni bcu ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: mnar sems kyi dngos po ni bcu ste 'di ltar /

analyzed: bdag gis don med pa spyad do zhes mnar sems skye ba dang / spyod do zhes mnar @201b sems skye ba dang / spyod par 'gyur ro zhes mnar sems skye ba /

original: bdag gis mi mdza' mi gcugs pa'i don spyad do //
analyzed: bdag gis mi mdza' mi gcugs pa'i don spyad do //

original: spyod do // spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod do // spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: I am doing it. I will do it.

original: gnas mal la yang mnar sems skye ba'o //
analyzed: gnas mal la yang mnar sems skye ba'o //
