original: mnar sems dngos po bcu char yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: mnar sems dngos po bcu char yang phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The ten things that are the basis for ill will are completely abandoned by the path of the nonreturner.

original: mi dge ba'i las bcu ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las bcu ni /
translated: The ten nonvirtuous actions are

original: 'di ltar / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / tshig rtsub po dang / dbyen dang / ngag kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / tshig rtsub po dang / dbyen dang / ngag kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /

original: log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'o //

original: 'di rnams la srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang log par lta ba rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par spyod pa dang brdzun du smra ba dang log par lta ba rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and wrong views are completely abandoned by the path of the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: rtsub po dang / dbyen dang gnod sems rnams ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //

analyzed: ngag kyal pa dang brnab sems rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

original: kun du sbyor ba bcu ni /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bcu ni /

translated: Desire, anger, pride, views, doubt, holding discipline and ritual to be paramount, desire for existence, jealousy, stinginess, and ignorance.

analyzed: 'di rnams la lta ba dang the tshom dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo // 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang phrag dog dang ser sna kun du sbyor ba rnams ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The fetters of view, doubt, and the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices are completely abandoned by the path of stream-entry.üîΩThe fetters of sensual desire, anger, pride, and ignorance are completely abandoned by the path of nonreturn.

original: nga rgyal dang srid pa'i chags pa ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang srid pa'i chags pa ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //

original: log pa nyid ni bcu ste /
analyzed: log pa nyid ni bcu ste /

analyzed: log pa'i ye shes dang / log pa'i rnam par grol pa'o //

analyzed: dang log pa'i ye shes dang log pa'i rnam par grol ba rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

original: ngag kyal pa'i mtshan nyid log pa'i ngag dang log pa'i rtsol ba dang log pa'i dran pa dang log pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //

analyzed: phyin ci log la bcu gnyis ni 'di ltar /

analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag go zhes pa'i 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang / de ltar sdug bsngal la bde ba'o zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang /
translated: Similarly, the opposite of the notion of happiness in relation to suffering is a mistaken notion, a mistaken mind and a mistaken view.üîΩThe opposite of the notion of beauty in relation to the ugly is a mistaken notion, a mistaken mind and a mistaken view.

original: lta ba phyin ci log dang / mi sdug pa la mdzes pa'o zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes pa 'du shes phyin ci log dang /üîΩsems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log dang / mi sdug pa la mdzes pa'o zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes pa 'du shes phyin ci log dang /üîΩsems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log go //
translated: The opposite of the notion of a self in relation to non-self is a mistaken notion, a mistaken mind and a mistaken view.

original: 'di rnams la mi rtag pa la rtag pa zhes pa'i phyin ci log gsum dang / mi sdug pa la sdug pa zhes lta ba phyin ci log dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba zhes lta ba phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes lta ba phyin ci log rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis spong ngo //

original: mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa dang sems phyin ci log pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa dang sems phyin ci log pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis so //
translated: The error of perception and the error of mind that the impure is pure are eliminated by the path of nonreturn.

original: sdug bsngal la bde ba zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang sems phyin ci log dang / bdag med pa la bdag go zhes 'du shes phyin ci log dang sems phyin ci log rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis rab tu zad par byed do //

translated: The error of perception that suffering is pleasurable, the error of mind that suffering is pleasurable, the error of perception that the selfless is a self, and the error of mind that the selfless is a self are completely eliminated by the path of arhatship.

original: mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa ni bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems bskyed pa ni bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve types of unvirtuous minds.

original: 'di ltar / yid bde ba dang ldan zhing lta bar 'gyur ba dang ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'du byed dang / bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang ; yid bde ba dang ldan zhing lta bar gyur ba dang mi ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /

original: 'du byed dang bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / btang snyoms dang ldan cing lta bar rtogs pa dang ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / @202b 'du byed las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang /

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa lta bar gyur pa dang mi ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'du byed dang bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa zhe sdang dang ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang /üîΩ'du byed dang bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa lta bar gyur pa dang mi ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'du byed dang bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa zhe sdang dang ldan pa 'du byed las byung ba ma yin pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / 'du byed dang bcas pa las byung ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: The four types of mental activities associated with equanimity are: the generation of a mind not arisen from formative influence that is not associated with the view, the generation of a mind arisen from formative influence that is associated with equanimity, the generation of a mind not arisen from formative influence that is associated with aversion and mental unhappiness,üîΩthe generation of a mind arisen from formative influence that is associated with aversion and mental unhappiness, the generation of a mind associated with excitedness and the generation of a mind associated with doubt.

original: 'di rnams la lta bar gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: 'di rnams la lta bar gyur pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang the tshom dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam gyis rab tu spong ngo //
translated: Among these, the four types of mental activities associated with the view and the generation of a mind associated with doubt are completely eliminated by the path of stream-entry.

original: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gnyis ni lam gnyis kyis bsrabs par byas te phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong ngo //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gnyis ni lam gnyis kyis bsrabs par byas te phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis lhag ma med par spong ngo //
translated: The two thoughts associated with mental dissatisfaction are reduced by two paths and are completely abandoned by the path of nonreturn.

original: lta bar gyur pa mi ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni lam gsum gyis bsrabs par byas te dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis ma lus par spong ngo //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa mi ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa bzhi dang / rgod pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni lam gsum gyis bsrabs par byas te dgra bcom pa'i lam gyis ma lus par spong ngo //
translated: The four thoughts not associated with the afflicted view of the self and the thoughts associated with excitation are reduced by three paths and are completely abandoned by the path of the perfected being.

original: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ma yin pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of meditative attainment that are not shared in common with ordinary beings:

original: 'di ltar / 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: the meditative attainment of cessation of conceptualization and sensation and the meditative attainment of the result.

original: de la dang po la ni dri ba bcu ste 'di ltar /üîΩ'bras bu snyoms par 'jug gang yin //
analyzed: de la dang po la ni dri ba bcu ste 'di ltar / 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug gang yin //
translated: The first has ten questions:üîΩWhat is the meditative attainment of the result?üîΩWhat is the meditative attainment of the result?

original: gang las 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug / de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang //
analyzed: gang las 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug / de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang //
translated: What is meditative attainment?

original: ci yi don du snyoms par 'jug / ci ltar snyoms par 'jug yid la byed pa ci /
analyzed: ci yi don du snyoms par 'jug / ci ltar snyoms par 'jug yid la byed pa ci /
translated: How does one enter meditative attainment? What is the mental attention?

original: bsam gtan pa de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen du yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen du yin /
translated: What is the condition for the meditative attainment of that meditator?

original: gnas pa'i rkyen du yin /üîΩldang ba'i can du yin /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rkyen du yin / ldang ba'i can du yin /
translated: What is the condition for abiding?üîΩWhat is the condition for rising?

original: ci bsam gtan 'di 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsam gtan 'di 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'o zhe na /
translated: Is this meditative attainment mundane or supramundane?

original: de la 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin zhes pa /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin zhes pa /
translated: Regarding that, what is meditative attainment as fruition?

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'i sems mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa de ni 'bras bu snyoms 'jug zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu'i sems mya ngan las 'das pa ma gtogs pa de ni 'bras bu snyoms 'jug zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is the mind of the fruition of a spiritual practitioner, except for the nirvana that is the fruition, is called meditative attainment as fruition.

original: gang las 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa /üîΩdge ba ma yin /
analyzed: gang las 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa zhes pa / dge ba ma yin /
translated: From what is meditative attainment as fruition?üîΩIt is not virtuous.

original: mi dge ba ma yin /
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin /
translated: It is not nonvirtuous.

original: lam gong ma'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: lam gong ma'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: It is not the nature of the maturational result of the higher path.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is meditative attainment as fruition.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /üîΩdgra @203a * //
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na / dgra @203a * //
translated: What is meditative attainment?

original: bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: It is the arhat and the nonreturner.

original: 'di gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byed pas so //
translated: Since these two perfect meditative stabilization.

original: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug zhes pa mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug zhes pa mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i don du'o //
translated: For what purpose do they enter meditative equipoise? For the purpose of abiding happily in this life.

original: de bzhin du'ang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du'ang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said this:

original: kun dga' bo gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas tshor ba rnams kyi 'ga' zhig 'gags nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pas tshor ba rnams kyi 'ga' zhig 'gags nas /
translated: ‚ÄúƒÄnanda, when the TathƒÅgata, by not attending to all signs, stops some of the feelings,

original: sems mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
analyzed: sems mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsgrubs te gnas so //
translated: he attains and dwells in the signless meditative stabilization of mind.

original: kun dga' bo de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ches reg par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: kun dga' bo de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ches reg par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: ƒÄnanda, at that time the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs body becomes extremely light and malleable.‚Äù

original: ci ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar snyoms par 'jug ce na /
translated: How do they enter meditative equipoise?

original: de dben par song ste /
analyzed: de dben par song ste /
translated: They go to a secluded place.

original: 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'i don du /
translated: For the purpose of the result, meditative equipoise.

original: de dben par phyin te /
analyzed: de dben par phyin te /
translated: Having gone to a secluded place,

original: 'dug pa'am nyal nas sems bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dug pa'am nyal nas sems bsdus te /
translated: they sit or lie down and gather their minds.

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa la rjes su lta ba dang por byas nas /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa la rjes su lta ba dang por byas nas /
translated: Having first observed the arising and cessation of the five aggregates,

original: 'du byed rnams la rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la rnam par lta'o //
translated: He sees the formations.

original: de'i tshe rigs la longs spyod pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rigs la longs spyod pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: At that time, it is the wisdom that enjoys the lineage.

original: rigs longs spyod kyi ye shes de'i de ma thag tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa la gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: rigs longs spyod kyi ye shes de'i de ma thag tu mya ngan las 'das pa 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa la gtong bar byed do //
translated: Immediately after that wisdom that enjoys the lineage, he enters into the meditative absorption that is the result, nirvana.

original: gang dang gang la brten nas lam bsgoms par gyur pa de dang de la mnyam par bzhag ste 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang la brten nas lam bsgoms par gyur pa de dang de la mnyam par bzhag ste 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever he meditates on the path in dependence upon, he enters into meditative absorption on that very thing, and it becomes the result.

original: yid la byed pa ci zhes pa /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ci zhes pa /
translated: What is the mental attention?

original: 'dus ma byas bdud rtsi'i dbyings zhing nyid yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas bdud rtsi'i dbyings zhing nyid yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention to the unconditioned realm of nectar.

original: bsam gtan pa de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen du zhes pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rkyen du zhes pa /
translated: What is the meditative absorption of that meditator?

original: bsam gtan gyi rkyen ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rkyen ni gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: There are two conditions for meditative absorption:

original: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'o //üîΩgnas pa'i rkyen du zhes pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa'o // gnas pa'i rkyen du zhes pa /
translated: not mentally attending to any signs, and mentally attending to the signless realm.üîΩWhat is the condition for abiding?

original: gnas pa'i rkyen gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rkyen gsum ste /
translated: There are three conditions for abiding:

original: 'di ltar / mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mtshan ma thams cad yid la mi byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la byed pa dang / sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Not attending to any signs, attending to the signless realm, and previous conditioning.

original: ldang ba'i rkyen zhes pa /
analyzed: ldang ba'i rkyen zhes pa /
translated: The condition for rising is as follows.

original: ldang ba'i rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: ldang ba'i rkyen gnyis te /
translated: There are two conditions for rising:üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mtshan ma thams cad yid la byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mtshan ma thams cad yid la byed pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: Attending to all signs and not attending to the signless realm.üîΩIs the meditative attainment mundane or supramundane?

original: ci snyoms par 'jug pa 'jig rten pa'am 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: ci snyoms par 'jug pa 'jig rten pa'am 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes pa 'jig rten las 'das pa yin te /
translated: It is supramundane,

original: 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: not mundane.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dri ba bco lnga ni 'di @203b ltar /
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la dri ba bco lnga ni 'di @203b ltar /
translated: There are fifteen questions about the meditative attainment that stops discernment and feeling:

original: 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin de la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa gang /
analyzed: 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin de la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa gang /
translated: What is the meditative attainment that stops discernment and feeling? What is it to enter it and not enter it?

original: stobs ngu dang ldan pas snyoms par 'jug /'du byed du zhig 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug / bsam gtan pa 'di'i sngon du bya ba du yin /
analyzed: stobs ngu dang ldan pas snyoms par 'jug /'du byed du zhig 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug / bsam gtan pa 'di'i sngon du bya ba du yin /
translated: Since it is endowed with great power, it enters meditative attainment. How many formations cease when it enters meditative attainment? How many preparatory actions does this meditative attainment have?üîΩFor what purpose does one enter meditative attainment?üîΩHow does one enter meditative attainment?

original: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug / ci ltar snyoms par 'jug / de dag gi ldang ba ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug / ci ltar snyoms par 'jug / de dag gi ldang ba ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: How does one arise from them?üîΩBy what mind does one arise?

original: sems gang gis ldang / langs nas sems ci la gzhol bar 'gyur /üîΩreg pa ngu la reg par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems gang gis ldang / langs nas sems ci la gzhol bar 'gyur / reg pa ngu la reg par 'gyur //
translated: What mind does one incline toward upon arising?üîΩWhat is the contact upon arising?

original: dang po 'du byed du zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dang po 'du byed du zhig 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: What is the first formation that arises?

original: ro dang 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ci //
analyzed: ro dang 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ci //
translated: What is the cause of the cessation of feeling, perception, and formation?

original: ci snyoms par 'jug / de 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci snyoms par 'jug / de 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas she na /
translated: Is meditative attainment conditioned or unconditioned?

original: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here it should be said:

original: gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis 'jug pa med par gnas pa de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis 'jug pa med par gnas pa de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which is the state of non-engagement of mind and mental factors is the meditative attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhes pa //
analyzed: de la snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhes pa //
translated: What is the meditative attainment?

original: dgra bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba dag snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang phyir mi 'ong ba dag snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: The arhats and nonreturners enter meditative attainment.

original: 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byas pas so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par byas pas so //
translated: Because they have completed their concentration.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that does not enter meditative attainment?

original: so so skye bo dang rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang gzugs med du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: so so skye bo dang rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang gzugs med du skyes pa'o //
translated: The ordinary worldlings, the stream-enterers, the once-returners, and those who are born in the formless realm.

original: de la so so'i skye bo ni mnyam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo ni mnyam par 'jog pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, the ordinary worldlings do not enter meditative attainment,

original: yul ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yul ma yin pas so //
translated: because it is not their object.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The stream-enterers and once-returners do not enter meditative attainment,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par bcad pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par bcad pa ma yin pas so //
translated: because they have not completely eliminated the afflictions that are adverse to concentration.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa ni snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Those born in the formless realm do not enter meditative attainment,

original: phyis ldang ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis ldang ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no basis for emerging later.

original: stobs ngu dang ldan pas snyoms par 'jug ces pa /
analyzed: stobs ngu dang ldan pas snyoms par 'jug ces pa /
translated: It is said that one enters meditative attainment through possessing power.

original: stobs gnyis kyis te /
analyzed: stobs gnyis kyis te /
translated: Through two powers:

original: zhi gnas kyi stobs dang / lhag mthong gi stobs kyis so //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi stobs dang / lhag mthong gi stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of serenity and the power of insight.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi stobs kyis bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi stobs kyis bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of serenity, the four meditations and the four formless states are mastered.

original: lhag mthong gi stobs kyis rjes su lta ba bdun dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi stobs kyis rjes su lta ba bdun dbang du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the power of insight, the seven contemplations are mastered.

original: de la rjes su lta ba bdun ni 'di ltar /üîΩmi rtag pa rjes su lta ba dang / sdug bsngal rjes su lta ba dang / bdag med pa rjes su lta ba dang / yid byung ba rjes su lta ba dang / chags @204a * //
analyzed: de la rjes su lta ba bdun ni 'di ltar / mi rtag pa rjes su lta ba dang / sdug bsngal rjes su lta ba dang / bdag med pa rjes su lta ba dang / yid byung ba rjes su lta ba dang / chags @204a * //
translated: The seven contemplations are:

original: pa bral ba rjes su lta ba dang / 'gog pa rjes su lta ba dang / nges par spangs pa rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: pa bral ba rjes su lta ba dang / 'gog pa rjes su lta ba dang / nges par spangs pa rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: contemplation of impermanence, contemplation of suffering, contemplation of selflessness, contemplation of disenchantment, contemplation of detachment, contemplation of cessation, and contemplation of relinquishment.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi stobs ni bsam gtan gyi yan lag 'gog pa'i don du dang mi g-yo ba la mos pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi stobs ni bsam gtan gyi yan lag 'gog pa'i don du dang mi g-yo ba la mos pa'i don du'o //
translated: The power of serenity is for the sake of the cessation of the members of enlightenment and for the sake of faith in imperturbability.

original: lhag mthong gi stobs ni 'jug pa rnams nyes dmigs su mthong ba'i don dang / mi 'jug pa rnams la mos pa'i don to //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi stobs ni 'jug pa rnams nyes dmigs su mthong ba'i don dang / mi 'jug pa rnams la mos pa'i don to //
translated: The power of insight is the meaning of seeing the faults of those that have entered, and the meaning of aspiration for those that have not entered.

original: 'du byed du 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug zhes pa /
analyzed: 'du byed du 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug zhes pa /
translated: It is said that one enters meditative attainment after the formative forces have ceased.

original: 'du byed gsum 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'du byed gsum 'gags nas snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: One enters meditative attainment after the cessation of the three formative forces.üîΩNamely,

original: 'di ltar / ngag gi 'du byed dang / lus kyi 'du byed dang / sems kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ngag gi 'du byed dang / lus kyi 'du byed dang / sems kyi 'du byed do //
translated: the formative forces of speech, the formative forces of body and the formative forces of mind.

original: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi /
translated: In this respect, for those who are absorbed in the second meditative concentration,

original: ngag gi 'du byed rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dag rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dag rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the formative forces of speech, i.e. discursive thought and reasoning, are interrupted.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi /
translated: For those who are absorbed in the fourth meditative concentration,

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang dbugs dbyung ba dang dbugs 'jug pa dag rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang dbugs dbyung ba dang dbugs 'jug pa dag rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the formative forces of body, i.e. inhalation and exhalation, are interrupted.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi sems kyi 'du byed 'du shes dang tshor ba dag 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi sems kyi 'du byed 'du shes dang tshor ba dag 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: For those who are absorbed in the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation, the formative forces of mind, i.e. ideation and sensation, are interrupted.

analyzed: 'di'i sngon gyi bya ba du yin zhes pa /

analyzed: sngon gyi bya ba ni bzhi ste 'di ltar /

analyzed: de la bcing ba gcig pa zhes pa ni lhung bzed dang chos gos dag lus dang sdom pa gcig tu byin gyis rlob po //

original: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba med pa zhes pa ni /

analyzed: sbyor ba gang dang gang gis lus 'di la nye bar gnod pa kun du 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob po ;

translated: ‚ÄúHaving a limited time‚Äù means

analyzed: las dang las ma yin pa rnam par gzigs pa zhes bya ba dus yongs su chad pa thob par dge 'dun gyi las dang las ma yin pa 'ga' zhig gi don du 'tshogs pa la gand'i sgrogs pa'i sgra des ldang bar bya'o zhes byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: The one called ‚Äúseeing what is and is not to be done‚Äù attains the time-cut, and for the sake of any of the Sa·πÖgha‚Äôs actions or non-actions, the sound of the proclamation of the gavel will cause him to rise.

original: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug ces pa /
analyzed: ci'i don du snyoms par 'jug ces pa /

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i don du'o /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i don du'o /

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa ni /
translated: Abiding in comfort in this life

original: 'phags pa de rnams kyi ting nge @204b 'dzin tshogs pa rnams shin tu mi g-yo bar bya ba'i phyir ram rdzu 'phrul rnam par bsgom pa'i don du snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de rnams kyi ting nge @204b 'dzin tshogs pa rnams shin tu mi g-yo bar bya ba'i phyir ram rdzu 'phrul rnam par bsgom pa'i don du snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: is for the sake of the noble ones‚Äô meditative stabilization becoming very unmoving, or for the sake of cultivating miracles.üîΩHow does he enter?

analyzed: ci ltar snyoms par 'jug ces pa 'gog pa'i don du 'gog pa'i mngon par 'dod pas de dag dben pa'i gnas su song ste /

original: 'dug pa'am nyal te sems bzhums nas /
analyzed: 'dug pa'am nyal te sems bzhums nas /

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //

analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa nas 'du byed btang snyoms kyi ye shes kyi bar du'o //
translated: [He observes them] as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless, up to the knowledge of equanimity towards formations.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par zhugs te /

translated: Similarly, he enters the second meditative concentration, the third meditative concentration, the fourth meditative concentration, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the sphere of nothingness.

original: langs nas de ma thag tu snyoms par 'jug pa de la rnam par lta ste /
analyzed: langs nas de ma thag tu snyoms par 'jug pa de la rnam par lta ste /
translated: Having arisen, he immediately observes that meditative absorption.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa nas 'du byed btang snyoms pa'i ye shes kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang bdag med pa nas 'du byed btang snyoms pa'i ye shes kyi bar du'o //
translated: [He observes it] as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless, up to the knowledge of equanimity towards formations.

analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go //

analyzed: de nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched la lan gnyis lan gsum du sems bzhag ste /

original: sems kyi 'jug pa med cing 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa med cing 'gags pa'o //

original: sems mi 'jug pa dang 'gags pa la /
analyzed: sems mi 'jug pa dang 'gags pa la /

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa zhes brjod do //

original: de'i ldang ba ci ltar gyur zhes pa /
analyzed: de'i ldang ba ci ltar gyur zhes pa /
translated: What is the arising from that attainment like?

original: de ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar /

original: bdag ldang bar bya'o zhes yid la byas pas so //
analyzed: bdag ldang bar bya'o zhes yid la byas pas so //

analyzed: 'on kyang sngon du byas pa'i dus yongs su chad pa thob pa na ldang ba nyid do //

original: sems gang gis ldang zhe na /
analyzed: sems gang gis ldang zhe na /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i sems kyis phyir mi 'ong bar ldang ngo //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i sems kyis phyir mi 'ong bar ldang ngo //

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i sems kyis dgra bcom par ldang ngo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i sems kyis dgra bcom par ldang ngo //

original: langs nas sems ci la gzhol bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: langs nas sems ci la gzhol bar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: dben pa la gzhol ba'o //üîΩreg par bya ba dag du la reg par 'gyur zhes pa /

original: gsum la reg ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: gsum la reg ste 'di ltar /

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //

original: dang po 'du byed du 'byung zhes pa /
analyzed: dang po 'du byed du 'byung zhes pa /

original: sems kyi 'du byed dang / de nas lus kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed dang / de nas lus kyi 'du byed do //

analyzed: @205a * // shi ro ni 'du byed gsum 'gags shing rgyun chad pa ste /
translated: A corpse is the cessation and interruption of the three formative forces.üîΩThus:

analyzed: 'di ltar / tshe yongs su zad pa dang / dro ba nye bar zhi ba dang / dbang po rnams kyi rnam 'gyur zhig pa'o //

analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'du byed gsum ma 'gags shing rgyun ma chad pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar / tshe yongs su ma zad pa dang / drod ma nyams pa dang / dbang po rnams rab tu dang ba'o /

original: 'di ni de dag tha dad pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag tha dad pa'i rgyu'o //

original: ci 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dus byas sam yang na 'dus ma byas she na /
analyzed: ci 'du shes tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa 'dus byas sam yang na 'dus ma byas she na /

analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni 'dus byas sam 'dus ma byas zhes brjod du med do // snyoms par 'jug pa de ni ci'i phyir 'dus byas zhes sam /

original: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin zhe na /

original: gang gi phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams mi srid pas dang / 'dus ma byas la ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang bar shes par byar med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de 'dus byas zhes sam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams mi srid pas dang / 'dus ma byas la ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang bar shes par byar med pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa de 'dus byas zhes sam /
translated: Because conditioned dharmas are not possible in that meditative attainment, and because one cannot know that there is meditative attainment and emergence in the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //

original: 'di ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mtha'o //

analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa gnas brtan pa'i sde pa'i tshul lugs las 'phags pa'i bden pa la mkhas pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba le'u bco lnga pa'o
translated: From the system of the noble elders in the Sa·πÖgha of the Noble Land, the fifteenth chapter is called Ascertaining Expertise in the Noble Truths.

analyzed: / // /'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa'i lung las 'di ltar rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The scriptures of the noble Sa·πÖgha of the Sa·πÉmatƒ´yas present it like this.

original: bag la nyal ma yin pa ni rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
analyzed: bag la nyal ma yin pa ni rgyu bzhis 'gyur te /
translated: Non-latency is due to four causes:

original: 'di ltar / chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams kyi dbye ba dang / spang bya'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams kyi dbye ba dang / spang bya'i dbye ba las so //

analyzed: de la chos rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di ltar /
translated: The presentation of phenomena is as follows.

original: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ma brtags pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang ; rmugs pa dang / zhum pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ches 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha ba med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ma brtags pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang ; rmugs pa dang / zhum pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ches 'dzin pa dang /
translated: lack of faith, shamelessness, deceit, guile, lack of scrutiny, excitement, heedlessness, lethargy, slackness, lack of conscience, grasping,

analyzed: snyom las dang / gnyid dang / phrag dog dang / 'gyod pa dang / 'chab pa dang / dregs pa dang / ser sna dang / mi bzod pa dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / zas kyis rgyags pa ste nyer gcig go //
translated: laziness, sleep, envy, regret, concealment, conceit, stinginess, intolerance, resentment, and over-indulgence in food.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par bzhag pa ni @205b 'di ltar /üîΩde kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par bzhag pa ni @205b 'di ltar / de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa med pa ni /
translated: The definition of the characteristics is as follows:

analyzed: ma dad pa'o // gang zhig 'ang de kho na nyid ma yin pa la mos pa rab tu skyed kyang /

analyzed: de yang dman pa yin pas dad pa ma yin par shes par bya'o //

original: mnga' bdag ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mnga' bdag ma yin pa bzhin no //

original: dge ba spyod pa skyed pa la dbang po ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba spyod pa skyed pa la dbang po ma yin pa'am /

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod pa skyed pa la dbang phyug yin pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod pa skyed pa la dbang phyug yin pas so //

analyzed: rang nyid la 'dzem pa med pa ni ngo tsha ba med pa'o //

original: ngo tsha mi shes pa med par ni nyon mongs pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha mi shes pa med par ni nyon mongs pa skye ba ma yin no //

original: sgyu ni slu ba ste /
analyzed: sgyu ni slu ba ste /

original: rang dang gzhan shin tu bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan shin tu bsgyur ba'o //

original: 'di la rang bzhin gyi sems slu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la rang bzhin gyi sems slu bar byed pa'o //

analyzed: bslu ba med pa la nyon mongs pas go skabs mi red do //

original: g-yo ni sems g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems g-yo ba ste /

original: 'di ni rang nyid gya gyu can du gyur cing /
analyzed: 'di ni rang nyid gya gyu can du gyur cing /

analyzed: gzhan yang gya gyu can du drang bar 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: drang pos 'gro ba'i rgyud la nyon mongs pa skye ba ma yin no // ma brtags pa ni /

original: yang dag par ma brtags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ma brtags par byed pa'o //

analyzed: kun du brtags nas byed pa'i rgyud la nyon mongs pa skye ba ma yin no //

analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba'i sems ni rgod pa'o //

analyzed: nye bar zhi ba'i sems la nyon mongs pa skye ba yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: bag med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos dang rjes su ldan pa'o //
translated: Negligence is the possession of a defiled factor.

original: bag yod pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa skye ba ni med do//
analyzed: bag yod pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa skye ba ni med do//
translated: The defilements do not arise in a mind that is vigilant.

original: 'di rnams la rgyu la sogs pa lnga ni /
analyzed: 'di rnams la rgyu la sogs pa lnga ni /
translated: These five causes, etc.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rab tu mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rab tu mi ldan pa'o //
translated: are either associated or not associated.

original: de la gang mtshungs par ldan pa de ni kun nas dkris pa dang / gang rab tu mi ldan pa de ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //

translated: Among them, that which is associated is the envelopment; that which is not associated is of the nature of intimation and of the nature of non-intimation.

original: lnga gang zhe na 'di ltar /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na 'di ltar /
translated: What are the five? They are:

original: sgyu dang / g-yo dang / gzu lums dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang / g-yo dang / gzu lums dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o //
translated: deceit, dissimulation, violence, excitement and negligence.

original: gang thams cad du kun nas dkris pa'i sems la de rnams thams cad kyang yod pa'o //
analyzed: gang thams cad du kun nas dkris pa'i sems la de rnams thams cad kyang yod pa'o //
translated: All of them exist in a mind that is everywhere enveloped.

original: de ltar yang gang gi tshe gzhan slu bar byed pa de'i tshe gtso bor sgyu las bag la nyal ma yin pa'i mtshungs ldan thams cad kyang sgyu dang rjes su 'brel pas 'di dag kun nas dkris par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang gang gi tshe gzhan slu bar byed pa de'i tshe gtso bor sgyu las bag la nyal ma yin pa'i mtshungs ldan thams cad kyang sgyu dang rjes su 'brel pas 'di dag kun nas dkris par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when one deceives another, at that time, all the associated factors, which are not dormant states of deception, are also connected with deception, and so they are all entanglements.

original: gang yang de'i tshe rab tu mi ldan pa lus dang dag gi rig byed de yang sgyu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang yang de'i tshe rab tu mi ldan pa lus dang dag gi rig byed de yang sgyu zhes brjod do //
translated: Also, at that time, the non-associated formative forces, i.e. the bodily and vocal intimation, are also called deception.

original: rnam par rig byed de dag ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed de dag ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: These intications have the nature of intimation.

original: rnam par rig byed 'di rnams kyi rjes su dang lhan cig tu gzhan slu bar byed @206a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed 'di rnams kyi rjes su dang lhan cig tu gzhan slu bar byed @206a * //
translated: These intimations are followed by and accompany the deception of another.

original: pas ; de dag gi rjes ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: pas ; de dag gi rjes ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The following of these is the nature of non-intimation.

original: de bzhin du g-yo la sogs pa bzhi la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du g-yo la sogs pa bzhi la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the four, deceit and so on, should be explained.

original: gang lus dang sems kyi zhen pa de ni rmugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang lus dang sems kyi zhen pa de ni rmugs pa'o //
translated: That which is the attachment of body and mind is lethargy.

original: gnas ngan len zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gnas ngan len zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of depravity.

original: de la gang sems kyi zhan pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gang sems kyi zhan pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, weakness of mind is twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: Among them, the defiled is the envelopment.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gang lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni gang lus kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin de'o //

original: zhum pa ni zhan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zhum pa ni zhan pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Depression is the characteristic of weakness.

original: sems bkum  pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sems bkum  pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the essence of a contracted mind.

original: zhan pa 'di ni dngos po gang la chags pa de dag rgud pa las phal cher skye'o //
analyzed: zhan pa 'di ni dngos po gang la chags pa de dag rgud pa las phal cher skye'o //

original: khrel med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos lugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med cing mi 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: khrel med pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos lugs la sogs pa la ltos pa med cing mi 'dzem pa ste /
translated: Shamelessness is the lack of regard for the norms of the world, etc., and the lack of embarrassment.

original: sdig pa spyod pa la sogs pa la rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa spyod pa la sogs pa la rig par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the instigator of the performance of evil, etc.

original: ches 'dzin pa ni lta ba mi gtong pa ste /
analyzed: ches 'dzin pa ni lta ba mi gtong pa ste /
translated: Conceit is the non-abandonment of views.

original: lta bar bgyis pa la sogs pa dam pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pas mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: lta bar bgyis pa la sogs pa dam pa ma yin pa'i 'dzin pas mi gtong ba'o //
translated: It is the non-abandonment due to the grasping of false doctrines, such as the doctrine of self, etc.

original: snyom las ni las lci ba ste /
analyzed: snyom las ni las lci ba ste /
translated: Laziness is the heaviness of action.

original: ldang ba lci ba nyid do zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: ldang ba lci ba nyid do zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúheavy‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúdifficult to rise from.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: ‚Äù It is of two kinds:

original: gang sems kyi las ljid pa de ni nges par kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems kyi las ljid pa de ni nges par kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: The heavy action of the mind is the fetter.

original: gang lus kyi rnam par rig byed zhan pa ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang lus kyi rnam par rig byed zhan pa ni rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The light action of the body is the nature of the expression.

original: gnyid ni sems sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni sems sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the contraction of the mind.

original: de la gnyid ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la gnyid ni 'di ltar /
translated: There are two kinds of sleep:

original: sems dang bcas pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: with mind and without mind.

original: de sems dang ldan pa'i gnyid la rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de sems dang ldan pa'i gnyid la rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
translated: Sleep with mind is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //üîΩde la gnyid kyi bde ba la mngon par dga' bas gnyid du zhugs pa nyid kyi sems de ni nyon mongs pa can de kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o // de la gnyid kyi bde ba la mngon par dga' bas gnyid du zhugs pa nyid kyi sems de ni nyon mongs pa can de kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: afflicted and unafflicted.üîΩThe mind that enters sleep through delight in the pleasure of sleep is the afflicted fetter.

original: gang las so sor rtog pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag nas lus dang sems nye bar brtan pa'i don du gnyer ba de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang las so sor rtog pa'i dran pa nye bar bzhag nas lus dang sems nye bar brtan pa'i don du gnyer ba de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: The mind that enters sleep through the desire to rest the body and mind by means of mindfulness and introspection is unafflicted.

original: sems dang mi ldan pa'i gnyid ni rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang mi ldan pa'i gnyid ni rnam pa thams cad du sems dang sems las byung ba sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the withdrawal of mind and mental factors in all their aspects.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /üîΩnyon mongs pa las byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar / nyon mongs pa las byung ba dang / nyon mongs pa las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: de la nyon mongs pa las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa las byung ba ni /
translated: arisen from the disturbance of the humors and not arisen from the disturbance of the humors.üîΩThat arisen from the disturbance of the humors is

analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa can gyi sems 'gags pa'i de ma thag tu skyes pa'o //
translated: that which arises immediately after the cessation of a defiled mind.

original: lhag ma ni nyon mongs pa las byung @206b ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni nyon mongs pa las byung @206b ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The remaining is not arisen from the disturbance of the humors.

original: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pa nyid do //
analyzed: phrag dog ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa mi bzod pa nyid do //
translated: Envy is the dissatisfaction with another‚Äôs success.

original: 'gyod pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di ltar /
analyzed: 'gyod pa la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di ltar /
translated: Regret is of two kinds:

original: legs pa byas pa la'am bdag gis ma legs par byas so zhes rjes su gdung ba dang bya ba ngan pa ma byas pa'am bdag gis ma legs pa byas zhes pa ni gang 'di dag ma byas pa zhes rjes su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: legs pa byas pa la'am bdag gis ma legs par byas so zhes rjes su gdung ba dang bya ba ngan pa ma byas pa'am bdag gis ma legs pa byas zhes pa ni gang 'di dag ma byas pa zhes rjes su gdung ba'o //

original: 'di'i gnyis pa la rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar nyon mongs can dang nyon mongs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gnyis pa la rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar nyon mongs can dang nyon mongs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The second has two types: defiled and undefiled.

original: de la bya ba ma yin pa la byas pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byas pa la gang 'gyod cing yid la gcags pa de ni nyon mongs pa can kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba ma yin pa la byas pa dang bya ba ma yin pa byas pa la gang 'gyod cing yid la gcags pa de ni nyon mongs pa can kun nas dkris pa'o //

original: gang bya ba ma yin pa byas pa dang bya ba yin pa ma byas pa la 'gyod pa yid la gcags pa de ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin zhing kun nas dkris pa ma yin pa'o //

translated: It is not a defiled fetter when one regrets and feels remorse for what was done that should not have been done and what was not done that should have been done.

original: sdig pa yongs su sbed pa ni 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa yongs su sbed pa ni 'chab pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one's faults.

original: nad med pa la sogs pas khengs pa ni dregs pa ste /
analyzed: nad med pa la sogs pas khengs pa ni dregs pa ste /
translated: Arrogance is the swelling up of the mind due to health, etc.

original: kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: It is a fetter.

original: gang yang chang la sogs pa rnams kyis sems gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan nyid dregs pa ste /üîΩde ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: gang yang chang la sogs pa rnams kyis sems gzengs bstod pa'i mtshan nyid dregs pa ste / de ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: It has two types: defiled and undefiled.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can ni kun nas dkris pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: The afflicted is that which is associated with the entanglements.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rnam pa gsum 'di ltar /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni rnam pa gsum 'di ltar /
translated: The non-afflicted is of three kinds:

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'o //

original: des na dregs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des na dregs pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'o //

original: rab tu mi ldan pa'i dregs pa dang / dregs pa po'i rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rab tu mi ldan pa'i dregs pa dang / dregs pa po'i rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Haughtiness is of two kinds: non-associated and associated. The non-associated is of the nature of intimation and non-intimation.

original: ser sna ni nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni nor yongs su gtong bar 'dod pa med pa'o //
translated: Stinginess is the unwillingness to give up one's wealth.

original: mi bzod pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa sran mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa sran mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Lack of tolerance is the inability to bear suffering, etc.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /üîΩgrang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pa nyid dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar / grang ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzod pa nyid dang / gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa nyid do //
translated: It is of two kinds:üîΩthe inability to bear the suffering of cold, etc., and the inability to bear the harm done by others.

original: 'di dag la gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa ni kun nas dkris pa'o //
translated: The inability to bear the harm done by others is an entanglement.

original: gzhan ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pa'o //

original: kho na 'dzin ni gzhan gnod pa byas pa sems la 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kho na 'dzin ni gzhan gnod pa byas pa sems la 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: kha zas mangs pas myos pa ni zas kyis rgyags pa'o //

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /

analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi rang bzhin dang / sems las byung ba ni kun nas dkris pa'o //

analyzed: de rnams ni bag la nyal ma yin pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid do // khams dang spang @207a * //
translated: These are the characteristics of those that are not latent.

original: bya'i rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: bya'i rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The classification of the realms and the objects to be abandoned is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:üîΩlack of faith, shamelessness, deceit, guile, lack of vigilance, excitement,

original: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ma brtags pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang / dregs pa ste brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ma brtags pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa dang / dregs pa ste brgyad po rnams so //
translated: non-conscientiousness, and arrogance.

original: de la yang de rnams rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la yang de rnams rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /
translated: Among them, these are of five kinds:

original: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal gegs dang ; kun 'byung gegs dang / 'gog pa'i gegs dang / lam gyi gegs dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su sdug bsngal gegs dang ; kun 'byung gegs dang / 'gog pa'i gegs dang / lam gyi gegs dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are five groups of eight: 1. the obstacle to suffering, 2. the obstacle to the origin, 3. the obstacle to cessation, 4. the obstacle to the path, 5. the obstacle to meditation.

analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa lnga ste bzhi bcu tham par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su brgyad pa lnga ste bzhi bcu tham pa'o //
translated: In the realm of form, there are also five groups of eight, which make eighty.

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su bzhi bcu'o //
translated: In the formless realm, there are also forty.

analyzed: bzhi bcu la gsum ni brgya dang nyi shur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: khrel med pa dang ches 'dzin pa dang mi ston pa ste /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su 'di rnams la re re la lnga lnga ste lnga pa gsum ni bco lngar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi khams su bco lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the realm of form, there are also fifteen.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni med do //

analyzed: rmugs pa dang zhum pa dang snyom las dang gnyid dang phrag dog dang 'gyod pa dang ser sna dang mi bzod pa dang khon du 'dzin pa ste /

analyzed: dgu po 'di rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du lngar bye ste lnga pa dgu ni bzhi bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zas kyis rgyags pa'ang 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o //

analyzed: bag la nyal ma yin pa ni khams dang spang bya'i dbye ba tha dad brgya dang dgu bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //

original: yang gsungs pa /üîΩma dad ngo tsha med dang sgyu /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / ma dad ngo tsha med dang sgyu /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states,üîΩLack of faith, shamelessness, nonembarrassment,

analyzed: g-yo dang rgod dang ma brtags dang // bag med pa dang dregs pa rnams //
translated: Arrogance, lethargy,üîΩand excited speech are of five types.

original: rnam pa lnga ste khams gsum skyes //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste khams gsum skyes //
translated: They are born in the three realms.

original: mi ston khrel med ches 'dzin rnams //
analyzed: mi ston khrel med ches 'dzin rnams //

analyzed: ser sna mi bzod 'gyod pa dang // rmugs dang snyom las khon du 'dzin //

analyzed: zas kyis rgyags pa bsgom spang ngo //

original: yang dag la nyal min de rnams rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dag la nyal min de rnams rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: These are of three kinds:

analyzed: 'di ltar / thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu dang / sa chung ngu ba'o //

analyzed: de la thams cad du 'gro ba chen po ni bdun te /

analyzed: 'di ltar / ma dad pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / sgyu dang / g-yo dang / ma brtags pa dang / rgod pa dang / bag med pa'o //

analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba @207b chung ngu ni drug ste 'di ltar /

analyzed: gnyid dang / zhum pa dang / le lo dang / ches 'dzin pa dang / rmugs pa dang / khrel med pa'o //

analyzed: sgrub pa de ni bsam gtan ma yin /
translated: This practice is not meditation.

original: bsam gtan lam ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan lam ma yin no //
translated: It is not the path of meditation.

original: sgrub pa zhan pa de mtshan ma dang yongs su dag pa dag sgrub pa zhan par gyur pa ci srid du bsgom pa'i rang bzhin du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhan pa de mtshan ma dang yongs su dag pa dag sgrub pa zhan par gyur pa ci srid du bsgom pa'i rang bzhin du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: This weak practice is the weak practice of the sign and of purification. It is also the weak practice of cultivation.

original: ming la dmigs pa sgrub pa zhan pa rang bzhin spyod pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ming la dmigs pa sgrub pa zhan pa rang bzhin spyod pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: The practice that has as its object the name is not the weak practice of the nature.

original: yang sgrub pa zhan pa bsam gtan ma yin bsam gtan lam ma yin pa ci'i don du zhen brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sgrub pa zhan pa bsam gtan ma yin bsam gtan lam ma yin pa ci'i don du zhen brjod par bya ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the weak practice that is not meditation and not the path of meditation?

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang lam thams cad ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bde ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang lam thams cad ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i bde ba'i dngos po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the meaning of the complete happiness.

original: bde ba'i don yang dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba'i don yang dge ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of happiness is the meaning of virtue.

original: bde ba'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bde ba'i don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of pleasure is twofold:

original: yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: complete and incomplete.

original: de la gang gi tshe yongs su rdzogs pa de'i tshe dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe yongs su rdzogs pa de'i tshe dge ba'o //
translated: When it is complete, it is wholesome.

original: gang gi tshe yongs su ma rdzogs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yongs su ma rdzogs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is incomplete,

original: mi sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan du 'gyur ro //
translated: it is an unobscured neutral state.

original: gang gi tshe gang du dmar pa'i dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa de la dmar po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang du dmar pa'i dngos po yongs su rdzogs pa de la dmar po zhes brjod do //
translated: When the state of redness is complete, it is called red.

original: gang yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ni padma'i dmar po zhig brjod do //
analyzed: gang yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ni padma'i dmar po zhig brjod do //
translated: When it is incomplete, it is called the redness of a lotus.

original: gnyi ga dmar po yin pa de bzhin du dge ba dang mi sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan dag rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga dmar po yin pa de bzhin du dge ba dang mi sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan dag rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is with redness, so it is with wholesomeness and unobscured neutrality.

original: yang bde ba'i dngos po ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang bde ba'i dngos po ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the state that is not pleasure?

original: bde ba yin pa'i dngos po de dag gang du yongs su rdzogs pa de ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba yin pa'i dngos po de dag gang du yongs su rdzogs pa de ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: When the state of pleasure is complete, it is unwholesome.

original: gang du yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ni sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yongs su ma rdzogs pa de ni sgrib pa'i lung ma bstan pa'o //
translated: When it is incomplete, it is an obscured neutral state.

original: dper na bung ba dang zar ma'i me tog dag nag pa nyid tha dad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bung ba dang zar ma'i me tog dag nag pa nyid tha dad pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, the black color of bees and the black color of sesame flowers are different.üîΩ

original: yang @211a * //
analyzed: yang @211a * //
translated: For example, the black color of bees and the black color of oleander flowers are different.

original: gang du bde ba'i dngos po med pa bde ba ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa de ru ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gang du bde ba'i dngos po med pa bde ba ma yin pa'i dngos po med pa de ru ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can there be a neutral feeling where there is neither pleasure nor pain?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: gang la gnyi ga yang med pa de ni rang bzhin gyi lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la gnyi ga yang med pa de ni rang bzhin gyi lung du ma bstan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Where there is neither pleasure nor pain, that should be known as neutral by nature.

original: nam mkha'i ngang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngang bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.

original: de la bde ba'i don ni ming gzhan dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bde ba'i don ni ming gzhan dge ba'i don to //
translated: In this regard, the meaning of pleasure is the same as the meaning of virtue.

original: thams cad kun nas dkris pa ma yin zhing sdom pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kun nas dkris pa ma yin zhing sdom pa yin no //
translated: It is not a universal mental affliction and it is a restraint.

original: bde ba ma yin pa'i dngos po nyid ni ming gzhan mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ma yin pa'i dngos po nyid ni ming gzhan mi dge ba'o //
translated: The meaning of pain is the same as the meaning of nonvirtue.

original: thams cad kun nas dkris pa yin zhing sdom pa ma yin pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kun nas dkris pa yin zhing sdom pa ma yin pa yin no //
translated: It is a universal mental affliction and it is a lack of restraint.

original: ci ltar 'khor lo 'di rnam pha bzhir bstan pa /
analyzed: ci ltar 'khor lo 'di rnam pha bzhir bstan pa /
translated: Just as this wheel is taught to have four parts,

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis lung ma bstan 'khor lo yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis lung ma bstan 'khor lo yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: so too should the wheel of neutral by nature be described.

original: de la rang bzhin lung ma bstan 'khor lo la yang sngon bzhin du rjes su spyod pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin lung ma bstan 'khor lo la yang sngon bzhin du rjes su spyod pa mi skye'o //
translated: The wheel of natural indeterminate is also as before.

original: ci ltar mig gi rnam shes kyi de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam shes la yang 'khor lo rnam pa lnga dang / 'khor lo 'jig pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar mig gi rnam shes kyi de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam shes la yang 'khor lo rnam pa lnga dang / 'khor lo 'jig pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Just as with the eye consciousness, so too with the ear consciousness, the fivefold wheel and the destruction of the wheel should be stated.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / dge ba'i 'khor lo dang / mi sgrib pa'i 'khor lo dang / mi dge ba'i 'khor lo dang / sgrib pa'i 'khor lo dang / rang bzhin lung ma bstan gyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dge ba'i 'khor lo dang / mi sgrib pa'i 'khor lo dang / mi dge ba'i 'khor lo dang / sgrib pa'i 'khor lo dang / rang bzhin lung ma bstan gyi 'khor lo //
translated: The wheel of virtue, the wheel of nonobstruction, the wheel of nonvirtue, the wheel of obstruction and the wheel of natural neutral.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni sngon bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni sngon bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The body consciousness is fivefold as before.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Among them, obstruction is abandoned in the desire realm.

original: gzugs khams su mi dge ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs khams su mi dge ba spangs pa'o //

original: gnyi ga gcig tu byas pas rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga gcig tu byas pas rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: Both are combined into one, making five.

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: Even so,

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang gzugs kyi dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dag gcig tu byas te dge ba gcig go //

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dag gcig tu byas te mi sgrib pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dag gcig tu byas te mi sgrib pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the non-obstruction of the desire realm and the form realm, taken together.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi dge ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the unwholesome of the desire realm.

original: gzugs khams kyi sgrib pa ni bzhi ba'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dag gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: gzugs khams kyi sgrib pa ni bzhi ba'o // 'dod pa'i khams kyi dang gzugs kyi khams kyi dag gcig tu byas te /
translated: The fourth is the obstruction of the form realm.

original: rang bzhin gyi lung ma bstan ni 'khor lo lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi lung ma bstan ni 'khor lo lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the non-obstruction of the desire realm and the form realm, taken together.üîΩThe sixth is the neutral by nature of the desire realm and the form realm, taken together.

original: khams dang bcas pa'i reg bya la lus kyi rnam par shes pa de ni 'khor lo rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams dang bcas pa'i reg bya la lus kyi rnam par shes pa de ni 'khor lo rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body consciousness that has contact with obstruction and resistance has five aspects.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The mental consciousness also has five aspects.

original: de'i yang rjes su spyod pa dang so sor spyod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i yang rjes su spyod pa dang so sor spyod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not established as having a following or individual aspect,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang rgyud can yin pa'i phyir dang / drug pa chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rang rgyud can yin pa'i phyir dang / drug pa chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mental consciousness of one‚Äôs own continuum and because it is the great sixth.

original: sna'i rnam shes ni sgrib pa spangs pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sna'i rnam shes ni sgrib pa spangs pas rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The nose consciousness has four aspects, excluding the obstruction aspect.

original: lce'i rnam @211b shes ni /
analyzed: lce'i rnam @211b shes ni /
translated: The consciousness of the tongue

original: de bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: is also fivefold in this way.

original: de dag 'khor lo rnam bzhir bya //
analyzed: de dag 'khor lo rnam bzhir bya //
translated: They are divided into four wheels.

original: zhes so // yang gzugs la sogs pa la dge ba la sogs ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩbrjod bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // yang gzugs la sogs pa la dge ba la sogs ci ltar 'gyur zhe na / brjod bya ste /
translated: Moreover, how are form and so on virtuous and so forth?

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni sems kyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi dge ba la sogs pa rnams ni sems kyis byas pa ste /
translated: The virtuous and so on of form and so on are made by the mind.

original: de ltar yang rnam par rig byed gang zhig dge bas byas pa de rnams ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam par rig byed gang zhig dge bas byas pa de rnams ni dge ba'o //
translated: Thus, any indicative form that is made by virtue is virtuous.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi sems kyi skyed pa ni rang bzhin no zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyi sems kyi skyed pa ni rang bzhin no zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, that which is generated by the nature of the mind is natural.

original: de la rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang / sgra ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang / sgra ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Among them, the form of indicative action and sound are five types such as virtuous.

original: lhag ma gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi lung ma bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya dang thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi lung ma bstan to //
translated: The remainder, form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility, are all natural neutral.

original: chos ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: chos ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Mental objects are five types such as virtuous.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: gzugs dang sgra dang chos rnams la //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang chos rnams la //
translated: Form, sound, and phenomena

original: dge la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
analyzed: dge la sogs pa rnam pa lnga //
translated: are fivefold, such as virtue.

original: dri ro reg bya'i khams rnams ni /
analyzed: dri ro reg bya'i khams rnams ni /
translated: The elements of smell, taste, and tactility

original: rang bzhin lung du ma bstan pa'o //üîΩzhes so // 'di ltar 'ang /
analyzed: rang bzhin lung du ma bstan pa'o // zhes so // 'di ltar 'ang /
translated: are neutral by nature.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams kyi lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dag gi dge ba la sogs pa ni drug pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po 'di rnams kyi lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed dag gi dge ba la sogs pa ni drug pas byas pa'o //
translated: Also, in this way, the virtue, etc., of the informative form of body and speech of these five collections of consciousness is made by the sixth.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang drug pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang drug pas byas pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the virtue, etc., of the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, etc., is made by the sixth.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang dag rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang sgra dag dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i sems las skyes pa de rnams sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba yin pas dang / de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sems las skyes pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang zag pa med pa'i sems las skyes pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang dag rnam par rig byed kyi gzugs dang sgra dag dang / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba'i sems las skyes pa de rnams sdug bsngal mthong pas spang bar bya ba yin pas dang / de bzhin du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i sems las skyes pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang zag pa med pa'i sems las skyes pa ni spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, those that arise from a mind that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation. Those that arise from a pure mind are not to be abandoned.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na'o //
translated: Noninformative form is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation alone.üîΩEye consciousness is of six types:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni spang bya las rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni spang bya las rnam pa drug ste /
translated: that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth ofüîΩsuffering, and similarly, that which is to be abandoned by seeing theüîΩtruth of origin, that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth ofüîΩcessation, that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of theüîΩpath, that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and that

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: which is not to be abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bya ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / spang bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: The first is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the second is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, the third is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, the fourth is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, the fifth is to be abandoned by cultivation, and the sixth is not to be abandoned.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam shes dang / yid kyi rnam shes dang / chos rnams la so sor drug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam shes dang / yid kyi rnam shes dang / chos rnams la so sor drug go //
translated: Similarly, there are six for each of the ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness, and mind consciousness, and for each of the six objects, such as form.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: mig sna yid kyi sems chos la //
analyzed: mig sna yid kyi sems chos la //
translated: The mind of eye, nose, and mind

original: yang min bzung bas drug yin no //üîΩ@212a * // zhes so //
analyzed: yang min bzung bas drug yin no // @212a * // zhes so //
translated: is not grasped, so there are six.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi yang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi yang /
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are alsoüîΩafflicted and natural outflows.

original: gang nyon mongs pa can dang rang bzhin ni de nyon mongs pa las 'byung ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa can dang rang bzhin ni de nyon mongs pa las 'byung ba zhes brjod do //
translated: They are said to be outflows from the afflictions.

original: de la rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lnga ste 'di ltar /

original: sdug bsngal gegs nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ci rigs par srid pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gegs nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar du ci rigs par srid pa'o //
translated: the suffering outflows, up to the outflows to be abandoned by cultivation.

analyzed: yang gang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa de ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang spang bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: Also, that which is not afflictive is abandoned by the path of meditation and is not to be abandoned.

analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di ltar /

translated: those to be abandoned by the path of meditation and those not to be abandoned.

original: yang gsungs pa /

original: sna sogs sems la rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: sna sogs sems la rnam pa gnyis //

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /

analyzed: bya min gzugs ni bsgom spang ngo //
