original: zhes so // lus kyi rnam par rig byed dang dag gi rnam par rig byed dag spang bya las rnam pa lnga'o //

original: yang gsungs pa /üîΩrnam par rig byed gang rnam lnga //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / rnam par rig byed gang rnam lnga //
translated: Again, it is said:üîΩIndicative form is of five types.

analyzed: zhes so // sdom pa ma yin pa yang spang bya las rnam pa lnga'o //

analyzed: ces so // pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde ba'i lung gi tshul las bag la nyal ma yin pa rnam par des pa zhes bya ba le'u bcu drug

original: pa'o / // / bag la nyal yang rnam par gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: pa'o / // / bag la nyal yang rnam par gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: The latent tendencies are also posited in four ways:

original: 'di ltar / chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams kyi dbye ba dang / spang bya'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chos rnam par gzhag pa dang / mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams kyi dbye ba dang / spang bya'i dbye ba'o //
translated: the presentation of the factors, the presentation of the characteristics, the classification of the constituents, and the classification of the objects to be eliminated.

original: de la chos rnam par gzhag pa ni bag la nyal bcu ste /
analyzed: de la chos rnam par gzhag pa ni bag la nyal bcu ste /
translated: The presentation of the factors is the ten latent states.

original: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / log par lta ba dang / rang lus la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / log par lta ba dang / rang lus la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Thus, there is attachment, anger, pride, ignorance, wrong view, the view of the transitory collection, extreme views, holding a view as paramount, holding ethics and spiritual disciplines as paramount,

original: @212b the tshom mo //
analyzed: @212b the tshom mo //
translated: and doubt.

original: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /üîΩ'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste / 'dod chags ni zhen pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The presentation of the characteristics is as follows.üîΩAttachment has the characteristic of clinging.

original: khong khro ni zhe sdang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: khong khro ni zhe sdang ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Anger has the characteristic of hatred.

original: nga rgyal ni mthon po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni mthon po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Pride has the characteristic of haughtiness.

original: ma rig ni kun du rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig ni kun du rmongs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Ignorance has the characteristic of complete delusion.

original: log par lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Wrong view is twofold.

original: 'di ltar / sbyin pa med ces pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa 'jig par byed pa'i log par lta ba dang / gzugs mi rtag zhes pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sbyin pa med ces pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa 'jig par byed pa'i log par lta ba dang / gzugs mi rtag zhes pa la sogs pa phyin ci log tu rtogs pa'i log par lta ba'o //
translated: The wrong view that conceives the impermanence of form, etc. is the wrong view that conceives the opposite.

original: chos dang sems pa la bdag tu brtags pa ni rang lus la lta ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang sems pa la bdag tu brtags pa ni rang lus la lta ba'o //
translated: The imputation of a self in regard to phenomena and volition is the view of one's own body.

original: gang zag la rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin par brtags pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la mchog 'ba' zhig tu rtog pa ni lta ba'i mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la rtag pa dang rtag pa ma yin par brtags pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o // zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la mchog 'ba' zhig tu rtog pa ni lta ba'i mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The imputation of permanence and impermanence in regard to the personal entity is the view of grasping extremes.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la dag par brtags pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos la dag par brtags pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The conception of the purity of dharmas that are subject to impurity is the view of grasping at false modes of conduct.

original: the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: the tshom ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Doubt is twofold:

original: bden pa la skur ba smra ba dang / rnam par bya ba la skur ba smra ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa la skur ba smra ba dang / rnam par bya ba la skur ba smra ba'o //
translated: doubt in regard to the truths and doubt in regard to the performance of action.

original: de la bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Among them, the denial of the truths is fourfold:

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal la skur ba 'debs pa dang / kun 'byung la skur ba dang / 'gog pa la skur pa dang / lam la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal la skur ba 'debs pa dang / kun 'byung la skur ba dang / 'gog pa la skur pa dang / lam la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are four kinds of denial: denial of suffering, denial of origination, denial of cessation, and denial of the path.

original: rnam par byang ba la skur ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la skur ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of denial of purification:

original: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas la skur ba 'debs pa dang / chos la skur ba smra ba dang / dge 'dun la skur ba smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas la skur ba 'debs pa dang / chos la skur ba smra ba dang / dge 'dun la skur ba smra ba'o //
translated: Thus, there are three kinds of denial of purification: denial of the Buddha, denial of the Dharma, and denial of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la the tshom za ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gegs nyid de //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun la the tshom za ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gegs nyid de //
translated: Doubt about the Buddha and the Sa·πÖgha is an obstacle to the truth of suffering.

original: chos la the tshom za ba ni 'gog pa'i gegs so //
analyzed: chos la the tshom za ba ni 'gog pa'i gegs so //
translated: Doubt about the Dharma is an obstacle to the truth of cessation.

original: bden pa la skur pa yang so sor bzhi ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: bden pa la skur pa yang so sor bzhi ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are four kinds of denial of the truths, one for each truth:

original: sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang / kun 'byung gegs dang / 'gog pa'i gegs dang / lam gyi gegs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang / kun 'byung gegs dang / 'gog pa'i gegs dang / lam gyi gegs so //
translated: denial of the truth of suffering, denial of the truth of origination, denial of the truth of cessation, and denial of the truth of the path.

original: khams kyi dge bas rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: khams kyi dge bas rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: There are three kinds of virtue of the elements:

original: 'dod pas bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi bsdus pa dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi bsdus pa dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: virtue included in the realm of desire, virtue included in the realm of form, and virtue included in the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pas bsdus pa ni bcu ste /
translated: Ten are subsumed by the desire realm.

original: 'di ltar / gzugs kyis bsdus pa dgu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs kyis bsdus pa dgu ste /
translated: Nine are subsumed by the form realm.

original: de nyid khong khro spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid khong khro spangs pa'o //
translated: The same, excluding anger.

original: gzugs med pas sdus pa dgu ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pas sdus pa dgu ste /
translated: Nine are subsumed by the formless realm.

original: de nyid khong khro spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid khong khro spangs pa'o //
translated: The same, excluding anger.

original: spang bya'i dbye bas bag la nyal rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang bya'i dbye bas bag la nyal rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five types of latent states are differentiated by the objects to be abandoned.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mthong @213a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa mthong @213a * //
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation,

original: bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, and objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five types of attachment in the desire realm.

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam bsgom pas spang bya'o //üîΩde bzhin du gzugs khams su rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam bsgom pas spang bya'o // de bzhin du gzugs khams su rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation on the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.üîΩSimilarly, there are five types in the form realm.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med khams su rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med khams su rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Similarly, there are five types in the formless realm.

original: lnga pa gsum ni 'dod chags bco lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga pa gsum ni 'dod chags bco lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five groups of three make fifteen.

original: de bzhin du nga rgyal rnam pa bco lnga dang / de bzhin du rmongs pa bco lnga dang / bco lnga la gsum ni bzhi bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du nga rgyal rnam pa bco lnga dang / de bzhin du rmongs pa bco lnga dang / bco lnga la gsum ni bzhi bcu rtsa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: There are fifteen types of pride, fifteen types of delusion, and three groups of fifteen, making forty-five.

original: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Wrong views are of four types in the realm of desire:

original: 'di ltar ; sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ; sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: those to be abandoned by seeing the truth of unsatisfactoriness, the truth of the origin of unsatisfactoriness, the truth of cessation, and the truth of the path.

original: de bzhin du gzugs su rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs su rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types in the realm of form.

original: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩ'di ni log par lta ba bzhi pa gsum ste bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam pa bzhi'o // 'di ni log par lta ba bzhi pa gsum ste bcu gnyis so //
translated: There are four types in the formless realm.üîΩThese make twelve wrong views.

original: de bzhin du lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bcu gnyis so ;
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa bcu gnyis so ;
translated: There are twelve overesteemings of morality and ritual.üîΩThere are twelve doubts.

original: / the tshom rnam pa bcu gnyis dang / bcu gnyis pa gsum ni sum cu drug go //
analyzed: / the tshom rnam pa bcu gnyis dang / bcu gnyis pa gsum ni sum cu drug go //
translated: There are three groups of twelve, making thirty-six.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of overesteeming of morality and ritual in the realm of desire:

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs khams su rnam pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs khams su rnam pa gnyis dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i khams su rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, there are two types in the form realm and two types in the formless realm.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis pa gsum ste drug go //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis pa gsum ste drug go //
translated: These are the six types of clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: de la gzugs med pa'i khams su tshul khrims med pas brtul zhugs 'ba' zhig tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa'i khams su tshul khrims med pas brtul zhugs 'ba' zhig tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Since there is no morality in the formless realm, it should be understood that there is only ritual.

original: rang gi lus la lta ba ni khams gsum du lus dam par lta ba gsum ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya kho na'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus la lta ba ni khams gsum du lus dam par lta ba gsum ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bya kho na'o //
translated: The three views that the body is pure, blissful, and permanent in the three realms are to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering alone.

original: de bzhin mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin mthar 'dzin par lta ba gsum mo //
translated: Similarly, there are three views that grasp the extreme of permanence.

original: gnyis po 'di las khams gsum du drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di las khams gsum du drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: From these two, there are six types in the three realms.

original: zhe sdang ni 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni 'dod pa'i khams su rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Hatred has five types in the desire realm:

original: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'gog pa lam bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: to be abandoned by the path of meditation that is, by insight into the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: de ltar bag la nyal de rnams ni khams dang spang bya'i dbye bas phye ba na dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bag la nyal de rnams ni khams dang spang bya'i dbye bas phye ba na dgu bcu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when these dormant states are distinguished by realm and by the objects to be abandoned, there are ninety-eight.

original: yang bag la nyal rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
analyzed: yang bag la nyal rnam pa gsum ste 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover, there are three types of dormant states:

original: thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu dang / sa chung ngu ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu dang / sa chung ngu ba'o //
translated: great pervasive, small pervasive, and small.

original: kun du 'gro ba chen @213b po ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba chen @213b po ni gti mug ste /
translated: Great pervasive is delusion.

original: khams re re la spang bya'i dbye ba tha dad pa rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: khams re re la spang bya'i dbye ba tha dad pa rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: There are five types of objects to be abandoned in each realm.

original: kun du 'gro ba chung ngu ni drug ste /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba chung ngu ni drug ste /
translated: Small pervasive is six:

original: 'di ltar / log par lta ba dang / rang lus la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / log par lta ba dang / rang lus la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: wrong view, view of the body, extreme view, esteeming views, esteeming morality and asceticism, and doubt.

original: sa chung ngu ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sa chung ngu ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Small is three:

original: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal lo //
translated: desire, anger, and pride.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: kun 'gro chen po rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'gro chen po rmongs pa'o //
translated: The great universal is delusion.

original: yid gnyis dang ni lta ba lnga //
analyzed: yid gnyis dang ni lta ba lnga //
translated: Doubt and the five views

original: kun 'gro chung ngu'o lhag ma ni //
analyzed: kun 'gro chung ngu'o lhag ma ni //
translated: are the small universal. The rest

original: nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa'o //
translated: are the small secondary afflictions.

original: zhes so // yang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhes so // yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are also five types:

original: 'di ltar / thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang mtshungs pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu lta bu dang / sa chung ngu ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chen po dang mtshungs pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu dang / thams cad du 'gro ba chung ngu lta bu dang / sa chung ngu ba'o //
translated: the great universal, that which is similar to the great universal, the small universal, that which is similar to the small universal, and the small stage.

original: gang kun du 'go ba nyid du gsungs pa /üîΩkhams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang kun 'byung gi gegs dag bag la nyal de ni kun du 'gro ba chen po nyid do //
analyzed: gang kun du 'go ba nyid du gsungs pa / khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang kun 'byung gi gegs dag bag la nyal de ni kun du 'gro ba chen po nyid do //
translated: That which is said to be universalüîΩis the great universal because it is the latency of the obstructions to the suffering and origin of the three realms.

original: bag la nyal de nyid 'gog pa'i gegs dang lam gyi gegs dag ni kun du 'gro ba chen po lta bu'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal de nyid 'gog pa'i gegs dang lam gyi gegs dag ni kun du 'gro ba chen po lta bu'o //
translated: That very latency is the small universal because it is the latency of the obstructions to cessation and the path.

original: gang kun du 'gro ba chung ngu gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang kun du 'gro ba chung ngu gsungs pa /
translated: That which is said to be the small universalüîΩis the small universal because it is the latency of the obstructions to the small stage.

original: lta ba lnga dang the tshom de ni sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang kun 'byung gi gegs dag ni kun du 'gro ba chung ngu'o ;
analyzed: lta ba lnga dang the tshom de ni sdug bsngal gyi gegs dang kun 'byung gi gegs dag ni kun du 'gro ba chung ngu'o ;
translated: The five views and doubt are the small pervasive negative tendencies that are the hindrances to the truths of suffering and origin.

original: / de nyid 'gog pa'i gegs dang lam gyi gegs ci ltar srid pa ni kun du 'gro ba chung ngu lta bu'o //
analyzed: / de nyid 'gog pa'i gegs dang lam gyi gegs ci ltar srid pa ni kun du 'gro ba chung ngu lta bu'o //
translated: They are the small pervasive negative tendencies that are the hindrances to the truths of cessation and path, as is appropriate.

original: 'dir ci ltar srid pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci ltar srid pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of as is appropriate here?

original: brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be stated.

original: rang lus la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa lta ba gsum ni thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba lta bu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang lus la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes pa lta ba gsum ni thams cad du yod pa ma yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba lta bu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The three views that are the view of the body, the view grasping an extreme and the view clinging to rules and ritual as supreme do not exist everywhere and therefore they are like the pervasive negative tendencies.

original: khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal rnams sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma rig pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang nga rgyal rnams sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Ignorance that is to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the three realms, attachment, aversion and pride in the desire realm are five types since they are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation on the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path.

original: gzugs kyi khams su 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dag de bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dag de bzhin du rnam pa lnga'o //
